The position is primarily responsible for managing all costs related to construction and building projects. The position is also tasked to quantify the overall cost of a project thus ensuring value for money. Collects historical cost data to estimate costs for current or future project. Consults with clients, vendors, concerned business units, and/or contractor to discuss and finalize cost estimates Checks and reviews plans and other documentation to prepare time, cost, materials, and labor estimates. Confers with project team and contractors on changes and adjustments to cost estimates Assesses cost effectiveness of products, projects or services, tracking actual costs relative to bids as the project develops. Reviews construction materials and labor requirements Conducts studies to develop and establish standard hour and related cost data to effect cost reduction. Prepares cost and expenditure statement and other necessary documentation at duration of the project Prepares quantity take off/Bill of Quantities (Architectural, Structural and MEPFS) Prepares project data (Awarded/ Unawarded Package) for updating and monitoring purposes. Monitor and validate billings from contractors. Job Qualifications: Graduate of Bachelor in Science in Civil/Electrical/Mechanical Engineering With PRC License At least 2 years experience in construction cost estimate Can read architectural plans and develop cost estimates Can multitask and meet strict deadline With excellent communication and negotiation abilities Willing to work in Makati Can start ASAP

JOB SUMMARY Directly responsible in managing facilities, equipment, utilities, and installations in the common areas of the estate are operational. Provide optimal services – general and administrative to external and internal customers and support the Community of Administration’s Section with their requirements related to facilities maintenance. Ensure compliance to Home Improvement related policies & restrictions. He/she will review, approve and monitor house improvement projects. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES I. Monitoring of house alteration and improvement of homeowners: Orientation of buyers re: guidelines & requirements on house improvements Regular inspection of the unit during the time of improvement Final inspection prior to release of construction bond Recommends release of construction bond (construction bond form) process request forconstruction bond refund. Approval of layout plan​ II. Provide support to the Division Head in the implementation of estate and asset management processes, procedures: Perform continual inspections of the properties to ensure that all is properly maintained and that the environment is safe and attractive Prepare list of capital replacements required or anticipated, when applicable and submit to Division Head in advance of budget preparation​ III. Other Tasks: Assists in the external compliance of government regulatory permits and clearances in coordination with general accounting department. Oversees and supervises the various support services functions (i.e. allied services, office maintenance, motor pool, asset management, file management, and document duplication). Implements the disposal/decommissioning of the company assets considered as scrap or unusable in accordance with administrative policies in coordination with the asset disposal committee and ensures that the best interest of the company is served. Prepares and recommends a working budget related to facilities maintenance. Directly coordinates and maintains good relations with utility companies, local government agencies, police, fire protection, the church, contractors, neighborhood. QUALIFICATIONS Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/ College Degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent. Extensive knowledge in property/estate management, facilities maintenance, administration, and general services. Must have strong personal computer skills and be effective with office application software. Should be knowledgeable in construction / fit out. Strategic and analytical and has ability to coordinate, negotiate and work with people.

Company: Global Estate Resorts, Inc. (a subsidiary of Megaworld Corporation)
Location: Batangas, Cavite, Laguna (Calamba City), Laguna (Others), Laguna (San Pablo City), Laguna (Sta. Rosa City), Quezon
Job Description: QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess a Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering with PRC License. At least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural Applicants must be willing to be assigned in Laguna. Free housing for site based employees. RESPONSIBILITIES: Coordinates with contractors and directly reports to Project-in-charge for all Civil/Structural/Site Development related concerns. Checks and reviews engineering drawings from ID and PDD and conducts site inspection prior to project implementation. Identifies project risks and recommends counter-measures to contractors/suppliers. Monitors daily accomplishment, inventory of materials and manpower. Prepares purchase requisition forms (PR) with accurate quantities and ensures timely delivery of owner furnished materials (OFM's). Prepares all construction-related documents (e.g. PM Instructions, Change order forms, Request for Information/Approval etc.) Ensures construction quality adheres to issued Final Construction Plans and approved specifications. Maintains proper housekeeping and over-all safety of project site. Collates punch lists and ensures that all are completed within acceptable limits and prescribed deadline. Devises action plan for site issues/concerns promptly considering the most cost-effective measures. Evaluates billing requests of contractors/suppliers for payment processing. Handles the settlement and closing of project accounts to all stakeholders (vendors/contractors etc.) which includes the preparation and review of billing requests. Consolidates, reviews and submits the project's close out report to the immediate leader for checking and client's acceptance.

Prepare/obtain Quantity take-off for the Architectural Works based on the schematic plan;• Prepare/obtain Quantity take-off for the Structural Works based on the elemental parameters;• Prepare BQ and cost all the quantities therein for the approval of Unit Head;• Maintain, monitor and update Cost Data Bank thru:2..1 Prepare project data of the awarded project & upload it in the data bank in the server;2..2 Evaluate cost submitted by quotation for current project and to be added in the Cost Data Bank.• Detailed measurement take-off;• Input all the evaluated & acceptable cost of the corresponding items with quantities in the Bill;• Prepare/identify plans for photocopy for pick-up of subcons/suppliers;• Prepare letter for request of quotation from subcons/suppliers for different items for costings;• Obtain accurate Quantity take-off for the following scope of works as per assignment;• Identify queries, qualifications made during the course of quantity take-off;• Review completeness of the attachment being requested for approval RBR which includes; Subcon proposal for said scope of work;• Preparation of Abstract of Bid/analysis for approval of the unit head & endorsement to Bidcom;• Log the reference RBR no at the Estimating Server for Monitoring;• Review completeness of the attachment being requested for approval QER, which includes:2..1 Operating Budget for the scope of work subject for QER or SAP copy;2..2 Subcon/s Proposal for the said scope of work;2..3 Approved Change Order from the owner if owner initiated.2..4 Memo from the Project Manager regarding the change order if MDC initiated;• Reconciled quantity with Quantity Surveyor if applicable;• Log the reference QER no at the Estimating Server for Monitoring;• Evaluate and reconciliation of Variation (Change Orders);• Prepare and monitor RBR;• Prepare regularly issued Progress Billings (Interim Valuation);• Prepare site measurement and % accomplishment;• Prepare documentation and submit renewal of Corporate Licenses (PCAB; POCB; Customs Accreditation);• Create/amend contracts of all MDC projects in SAP;• Assist in processing billings of Legal retainers including insurance & bonding companies;• Assist in the preparation of required documents in securing bonds and insurances;• Secure and monitor bonds and insurances of entire MDC project;• Coordinates with bonding and insurance company’s representatives for other documents needed in securing bonds;• Update MDC profile to bonding and insurance company;• Monitor & Secure bond/insurances extensions for MDC projects;• Assist in securing of construction licenses from government regulatory agencies (i.e. Philgeps - DPWH);• Assist/Prepare documents in securing Certifications from government regulatory agencies;• Prepare contracts as requested by all MDC projects including those from the corporate & MDC Employees for review & Notarization i.e. Lease Contract;• Service Agreements, security agencies, hospitals/ clinics, retainers, employees etc.;• Prepare and issue a) Affidavit; b) Quit Claims; c) Proj Undertakings; based on the requests made by all MDC projects for their progress billings, retentions, bonds etc.;• Prepare the request of Secretary's Certificate/Board Resolutions for the General AIF including specific acts and updating them regularly in coordination with ALI Legal;• Assist in the preparation and review contract documents between MDC and client (between MDC, ALI and ALI subsidiaries based on SLA);• Prepare pre-qualification requirements of MDC in private and public projects:2..1 Attends pre-qualification meetings for prospective Clients.• Coordinate with the different department of the Company:2..1 Finance department with regards to Financial Capability of the Company;2..2 Engineering department for Table of Organization (T.O);2..3 Human Resource Group for the updated resume of the identified person from T.O;2..4 EHS department for certification of Quality Management and other required documents (e.g. DOLE certification);2..5 ECPD for equipment owned by MDC.• Assist in the bidding process of MDC in private and public projects;• Assist/Prepare and up-date MDC Company Profile;• Monitor MDC Projects Monthly Accomplishment Report (for Net Financial Contracting Capacity of MDC);• Prepare and compile proper filing of records of the department;• Monitor OPB issued by COG for Variation works;• Check completeness of the attachment being request for approval Operating Budget, to wit:2..1 Operations Bill of Quantities that sums up the amount requested for Operating Budget;2..2 Reconciled quantities with Quantity Surveyor;• Coordinate with COG of respective projects, if there are clarifications on the OPB submissions;• Preparation of Endorsement Letter and assign OPB no. for approval of all the signatories;

SENIOR TEKLA DETAILER MODELER CHECKER AFTERNOON START . We employ people with the best attitude, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Steel Iconz, a structural detailing company is seeking candidates experienced in the position of SENIOR TEKLA MODELER DETAILER CHECKER for its Ortigas Pasig Office. This is a senior position that requires the applicant to demonstrate leadership skills and must possess an excellent attention to detail abilities. In addition, the position main responsibility involves an all-rounder in detailing, modeling and checking of drawings to deliver quality standards to clients and in a timely manner. This position is for the afternoon shift so you need to consider this information carefully before you apply. To be considered for the role, you must have the following skills set: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s/College Degree preferably in Engineering or Architectural or equivalent qualification. Minimum of 7 years’ experience using TEKLA Structures. Minimum of 7 years’ experience in Steel Detailing Modelling. Minimum of 5 years’ extensive experience in Checking. Experience and knowledge of standards and practices in the construction industry (knowledge of Australian/New Zealand standards would be an advantage). Understanding of drawings at all levels. Able to work under pressure and tight schedules. Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal English a must. Ability to develop and lead a successful team through effective communication. Excellent social skills especially in dealing with different stakeholders in the industry. Great team player, honest and with a "can do" attitude. Full-Time position available. NOTE: Please submit your Curriculum Vitae with a Cover letter outlining why you are suited for this position and must include your expected salary range. Remuneration is commensurate to your skills and experiences. Previous applicants with the above qualifications are welcome to re-apply. Due to the current pandemic, it would be an advantage if you have your own transport to work. The successful applicant will be provided a free car park.

Job Description: The Candidate should possess technical knowledge preferably on Civil Engineering Design and Construction Supervision. Job Responsibilities: · Prepares report, design calculations, drawing and technical specification. · Undertake Site Inspection (Rebar, Concreting, Soil Protection, Form Works). · Undertake Design Review. · Coordinate with the team member (Consultants), Contractor and Client. · Participates on internal meeting. · Participates on external meeting with the Contractor and Client related to the project. · Ensure timely submission and accuracy of work. · Monitor Project Quality Control · Monitor Project Accomplishment. · Check Weekly accomplishment Report of Contractor. · Ensure that the Contractor’s work is in compliance to approve plans and contract agreement · Ensure that Contractor’s Work are within the approved schedule. · Review of Contractor’s Work Variation and Claims. · Ensure accuracy of work of the Contractor. · Issuance of Memorandum and Non-Compliance Report to Contractor. · Monitor Contractor’s Materials and Equipment · Participate in Contractor’s Material Testing. · Participate in conducting Public Consultation Job Qualification: · Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s/College Degree and Professional License (Passed Board Exam in Civil Engineering) · At least 1 year(s) of working experience in design and construction (infrastructure project). Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office. Experience in Sewage Treatment Plant (STP) or Water Treatment Plant (WTP) is an advantage. A team player, with good interpersonal skills. Can work under minimal supervision. · Willing to be assigned in Metro Manila particularly in Quezon City, Pasig City and Manila City. · Contract Position (s) available.

Job Qualifications At least College Level or Vocational Course Graduate Certificate Holder of Occupational Safety & Health for Construction (COSH) or Basic Occupational Safety & Health (BOSH) for industrial facility. Advance safety training will be an advantage but not required. At least 2 years experience in the same discipline Knowledgeable pertaining to preparation and implementation of safety standards tailor made for a particular project. Above Average communication skills Computer literate Duties and Responsibilities Implements and ensures that the regulatory safety requirements of DOLE-BWC, Department Order No. 13 including R.A 11058 are satisfactory and consistently met at site, Formation of Health and Safety Committee at project site. Implementation of site-specific Construction Safety and Health Program of the Organization. Management of treatment facility or clinic and medical personnel such as Project Nurse or First Aider. Provision of information, fabrication / posting of safety signage, implementation of personal protective equipment, safety and health training / information / seminar, conduction of toolbox meeting, formation of safety committee, safety and health reports compliance, safety induction / orientation, etc. Conducts investigation of injury to personnel, loss or damage to property including near misses to determine causes and recommends corrective measures to prevent recurrence. Evaluates and suspends any operation or action that is judged an imminent hazard until the hazardous conditions or procedures are controlled or eliminated. Prepares and submits all safety reports required by the ESH Manager and consider / propose ideas to meet required safe ways to established a workable solutions. Performs inspection covering unsafe acts, unsafe conditions, and observance of safetyrules and regulations. Ensures peace and order, security and cleanliness at project site. Ensures that all construction debris, chemical containers and garbage on site are disposed in an environmentally sound manner. Coordinates with all site supervisors to include those of the trade contractors regarding safety and health requirements on site. Acts as a liaison officer to government and private agencies on matters pertaining to construction safety and health concerns. Participates in the implementation of the Organization’s Environmental, Occupational Safety and Health Program.

Job Qualifications Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) or Board passer with the same discipline. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - MEPFS or equivalent. Good in oral and written communication Computer literate Duties and Responsibilities Reviews plans and specifications for Mechanical, Plumbing and Fire Protection Works. Netatech Engineering Pte Ltd is actively seeking a highly motivated Junior level Hydraulics & Stormwater Water Designer for employment in the Philippines, Netatech Philippines Inc. Ortigas Office. Our Company is delighted to include you in a unique development opportunity, the ABC Waters Design Features and Stormwater Management Program. This job offers potential for development in a great working environment and the opportunity to apply the latest technology to help our clients solve their most challenging problems. Typical projects involve helping local and overseas client’s complete stormwater management, rainwater harvesting, bioretention and detention system projects. An ideal candidate would be an active person, open to learn, adaptable to change and have a strong work ethic. Joining a growing team will give you the opportunity to mentor other engineers, while learning new things yourself. The position is a composite of lead designer and staff mentor. Aspire to work on projects internationally. Our people bring deep industry knowledge to help you succeed. In this role you will perform engineering and consulting duties on a variety of ABC Waters Design Feature projects. Work may include planning, designing on current projects. May also include regulatory compliance and permitting on current and future projects in the Philippines. Projects will include stormwater management, Hydrology and Hydraulics, drainage system, erosion and sediment control, Landscape contouring, stormwater management & planning studies, and water & soil quality studies. The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to: Ø Reviews regulations and standards necessary to carry out project design and permitting work. Ø Review drawings and documents to assure compliance with company design and production standards. Ø Strong understanding of construction plan preparation and details. Ø Analyses reports, maps, drawings, tests, and other topographical and geologic data to plan and design projects. Ø Revit skills is a must. Ø Production of drawings, documents, and support/presentation graphics Ø Work closely with the Team Leader to produce Drawings for submission. And Able to work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team. Ø Effective time-management, written and oral communication skills, analytical, interpersonal skills and able to work in less supervision. Ø Uses basic computer software as a tool for solving basic engineering problems such as Word & Excel, and AutoCAD. Preferred Qualifications Ø Bachelor’s degree in environmental, civil, or related engineering field Ø 3-5 of related engineering experience with a focus on or drainage system, landscape, stormwater management, bioretention system, flood control, detention, drainage system, and Coastal Engineering. Ø Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ø Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Ø Efficient in AutoCAD and SketchUp, and intermediate knowledge in Revit. Experience in SWMM and other related Hydraulic Software is an advantage. What We Offer When you join Netatech, you become part of a company that envisions a future where cities are built beyond resilience and sustainability. And will be fully regenerative, producing sufficient food and water, and harnessing nature’s ability to maintain, restore, and to improve our ecosystem.

Job Description: WSP, a world leading management and consultancy firm, is seeking an Intermediate Structural Technician - Bridges, Maritime, and Structual to join their Transport team. The fast-paced firm is rapidly expanding, and this is a great opportunity to join a dynamic team of design and drafting experts who will support your growth and development. Position purpose: To work as part of our Structural Team to provide CAD support to engineering projects. Preparation of structural drawings developed from basic data supplied. Main Activities and Responsibilities: (including but not limited to) Assist project set up by agreeing drawing strategy, type and size of drawings and drawing numbering with project lead, and suggesting methods of drawing production to ensure efficient methods of working Agree priorities and deadlines for drawing production with Project Lead Develop general arrangement drawings from engineer’s sketches and other design team member drawings or details and develop sketches into co-ordinated details Responsible for the clarity, completeness and accuracy of drawings and presentation materials produced. Adheres to prescribed drafting standard and procedures. Follow QA, document control, archiving guidelines on all work Conscientiously works towards the group’s objectives and adheres to the company’s policy. Work with project team members on specified aspects of the project Perform tasks assigned by the Principal Civil Technician / Drafting Discipline Lead / Discipline Lead / Transport Manila Operations Manager/ Regional Team Executive in line with his experience, discipline or qualifications. Qualifications (Minimum and Desirable): Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Architecture, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. Required skill(s): microstation, projectwise, Revit, AutoCad. At least 3 - 7 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably with experience on Australian or NZ projects At WSP, being curious about the future inspires us to innovate and deliver impactful and sustainable designs today. Be part of our team doing purposeful work, helping our communities thrive today, while shaping them for tomorrow. To express your interest please click on the 'Apply Now' button.

Job Title: Group Head: Management of Ecology and Infrastructure
Job Description: Responsible in leading, controlling, managing and monitoring the overall operations of project management, architectural, and maintenance section. Perform the primary tasks of planning, directing and controlling of activities required for financial planning, financial analysis, budgeting, treasury, asset management, purchasing, human resources, and information management. Responsible for the decision on job distribution and implementation of systems and policies affecting the operations of the Department. Provides recommendations and proposals to Village Manager for innovation and improvements of work methods and existing practices and policies related to operations of AAVA. Decides on critical matters affecting management of resources. Perform other duties that may be assigned from time to time. Candidate must be a Licensed Civil Engineer or an Industrial Management Engineering graduate. With at least ten (10) years of working experience in the related field. Have an outstanding customer-focused attitude and approach. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills. Self-motivated, self-starter, creative and has the ability to deal well with all levels in the organization and community. Willing to work in Ayala Alabang Village Works schedule is from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM from Mondays thru Fridays.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Supervision of day to day operations of the site work.• Responsible for day to day site work;• Follow up with site engineers of Contractor and/or subcontractor to ensure that work is being carried out as per design drawings, specifications & meeting planned dates in schedule;• Interact with Project Manager for clarification in design;• Daily reporting about progress, non-compliance, delay in work to the Project Manager;• Ensure that Communication regarding any changes in plan have reached the engineers/Contractors and/or Sub-Contractor’s Representatives; • Conducting regular job site inspections;• Actively monitor the work environment for hazards;• Assist in the quality and safety audit;• Identify and highlight possible risk on project;• Assist in necessary project documentation;• Accurately inventorying the jobsite and ensuring that the supplies are properly maintained;• Support in finalization of Billing Break ups, Bill Certification etc.;• Coordination for verification of extra claims raised by the contractor Health, Safety & Environment; • Monitor evaluate and ensure that all work is being carried out safely;• Implement technical and safety requirements for the project;• Ensure that the main contractor’s HSE plan is being implemented and report all non-conformance to the HSE manager. Quality Assurance • Attend and review all benchmarking meetings;• Ensure construction QA/QC processes are being implemented by the contractor & sub-contractors;• Report any non-conforming work;• Identify and report technical queries to field engineering. Other Tasks Assigned Perform additional assignments as required by the needs of the operational unit, company, or as directed by the Project Manager and/or CEO. OTHER REQUIREMENT Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Architecture, Engineering (Civil), Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety), Engineering (Others) or equivalent. At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Fresh Graduates are also welcome to apply Preferably with exposure in QAQC Applicants must be willing to work in Mahogany Place 3,Acacia Estates,Taguig. Preferably 4 Yrs Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. 3 Full-Time position(s) available.

Position Goal: To coordinate & support the Project Management of Projects and form part of a team on larger scale new build developments and/orimprovement of existing company assets. Qualifications: Graduate of Architecture or Civil Engineering; licensed preferred but not required Has worked for a similar developer company, design firm, project management consultancy or construction firm for at least 1 to 2 years Good command of the English language, both oral and written Is knowledgeable of MS Office (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint) and has a background in using scheduling software, e.g. MS Project, Primavera, etc. Applicants must be willing to work in designated project sites. Full-Time position(s) available. Duties & Responsibilities: Communicate the needs requirements and constraints of the Project/s. Work with the constraints of the project to meet the signed Project Brief. Support the project team/s through pre-design, design, construction and completion stages of the project. Represent and promote the company throughout all projects. Achieve company profit targets. Contribute and support the local project team/s Physically monitor and report on the progress of the projects.

Copy and paste this link on your browser to know what it means: https://cloud.ph.jobstreetmail.com/PH-JS-CAN-Under-Verification Duties: A general foreman is responsible for overseeing the teams engaged in construction activities; and planning, coordinating, assisting in cost control, and ensuring a safe work environment. The general foreman job description entails operating and promoting safe working on site and implementing company requirements and legal regulations, paying specific attention to HSE legislation and quality The general foreman performs and records site inspections; as well as places orders, receives, and distributes materials to specified sections for future work. They are involved in recommending repairs, supervising the maintenance of tools and equipment, and determining work procedures. They are also responsible for planning the hiring of contract equipment and operators in order to assure proper utilization; and interpreting, implementing, and enforcing regulatory requirements related to safety, environmental, and industry standards The general foreman ensures all works are performed in accordance with approved method statements. They conduct and amend risk assessments, and deliver toolbox talks/briefings; and prepare reports on project time and equipment. The general foreman work description also involves interpreting plans, blueprints, and sketches of proposed structures in terms of the relevant specifications. Qualifications In-depth knowledge of construction procedures, equipment and OSH guidelines Understanding of electrical and hydraulic systems Ability to read drawings, plans and blueprints Excellent organizational and leadership skills 5-10 years experience in construction/real estate

JOB SUMMARY: The QA Engineer ensures that the quality of product of the product from plans to actual construction is strictly implemented. Duties include analysing and reviewing of plans and specifications, monitoring and checking of quality of works and implementing policies on QA. JOB DESCRIPTION: 1. Analyze, review, plans and specifications, attend pre-bid and construction meeting, and monitor construction activities, prepare reports to management if problem arises that needs proper action. 2. Arrange trainings/seminars for contractors and technical group on the correct construction and procedures that will improve quality standard and reduce construction based on time and/or cost 3. Perform research and development by using websites, finds articles from magazines and newspapers, attends seminars and exhibits, invites suppliers who will conduct on new construction products, systems and to each project group 4. Transmit correspondences and memoranda to all project groups on useful information and/or lessons learned from and to each project group 5. Random check on the quality of works, construction methods and perform material testing on on-going housing units, and development and open space amenities to confirm product compliance with the design and specification 6. Monitors and submits report for on-going projects in all project groups from time to time 7. Recommends and implements policies on quality assurance for project implementation 8. Performs research and development work related to quality assurance 9. Review, familiarize and suggests improvement on some details on plans and specification 10. Check and observe security and safety measures from time to time 11. Coordinates and prepare report on the status of every new projects from product concept phase to project implementation phase as well as documentations such as plans, permits, LTS and many more 12. Perform other related tasks as may be assigned from time to time. QUALIFICATIONS: Quality Assurance Management or Quality Control Management Plan Management Knowledge on Architecture Design Knowledge on Engineering or Construction Design Decision making Detail Oriented Knowledge on Land Development and mass housing activities Computer Literate especially AutoCad Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineer/Architecture Licensed Engineer/Architect With at least 2-year work experience in Architecture/Engineering Design

Job Title: Director, Project Management Office - Construction/Engineering Firm
Job Description: This is for an office-based position for a Construction/Engineering firm based in Alabang . Responsibilities: Collaborating with other department leaders to define, prioritize, and develop projects. Planning project management, including setting deadlines, prioritizing tasks, and assigning team members to various deliverables. Analyzing financial data, including project budgets, risks, and resource allocation. Providing financial reports and budget outlines to Executives. Overseeing the development of the project and ensuring that team members are carrying out their tasks efficiently while upholding the company's standards. Drafting new and improving existing project management office policies and processes. Continuously evaluating projects to ensure they are meeting company standards, adhering to budgets, and meeting deadlines. Accurately documenting the project's creation, development, and execution as well as documenting the project's scope, budget, and justification. Requirements: A Bachelor's degree in Business, Administration, or a related field. A Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification is required. A minimum of five years' experience in the industry. A minimum of one year's experience in a supervisory position may be advantageous. Strong leadership skills. Good written and verbal communication skills. Must be willing to work on-site.

Job Description Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent. At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): ORGANIZATIONAL PLANNING, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, LEADERSHIP SKILLS, DECISION MAKING SKILLS Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Electrical or equivalent. Willing to be relocated and stay in if needed. Job Responsibilities: Schedule the project in logical steps and budget time required to meet deadlines. Determine labor requirements and dispatch workers to construction sites. Consistently inspect and review projects to monitor compliance with building and safety codes, and other regulations. Interpret and explain plans and contract terms to administrative staff, workers, and clients, representing the owner or developer. Review contracts and negotiate revisions, changes and additions to contractual agreements with architects, consultants, clients, suppliers and subcontractors. Monitor and obtain all necessary permits and licenses. Direct and supervise workers. Study job specifications to determine appropriate construction methods. Select, contract, and oversee workers who complete specific pieces of the project. Monitor requisition supplies and materials to complete construction projects. Review and submit budget estimates and progress and cost tracking reports. Develop and implement quality control programs. Take actions to deal with the results of delays, bad weather, or emergencies at construction site. Confer with supervisory personnel, owners, contractors, and design professionals to discuss and resolve matters such as work procedures, complaints, and construction problems. Plan, organize, and direct activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Investigate damage, accidents, or delays at construction sites, to ensure that proper procedures are being carried out. Evaluate construction methods and determine cost-effectiveness of plans.

Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required skill(s): AutoCAD and Microsoft Office. SITE LOCATION: Paranaque Integrated Terminal Exchange (PITX), D. KMC Solutions is looking to hire Light Gauge Steel Detailers for one of Australia's leading supplier and installer of products to the residential building industry. The Ideal candidate will display ambition and a desire to develop their expertise. You will bring your keen eye for detail, and ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team. Typical duties include but are not limited to: Produce a cost efficient and cost-effective light gauge steel housing designs ensuring compliance with relevant building codes, industry standards, processes, and procedures. Liaise and assist with key internal and external stakeholders regarding technical design questions/queries. Read and interpret plans with a high degree of accuracy and be able to produce layouts, sections, and shop drawings in a timely and accurate manner. Produce light gauge steel housing designs to a high level of accuracy with great attention to detail within a timely manner. Produce detailed plans, drawings, and other documentation with the design intent for ease of manufacture and installation. Be responsible for assuring the quality of your own work and perform cross checks on piers work. Raise RFI’s as required, reviewing information and data provided by key clients, architects, engineers, or internal stakeholders. Qualities that we seek from our successful candidate include: Experience using Light Gauge steel software such as Vertex, Enduroframe, FrameCad, Scottsdale ETC Relevant Industry experience with sound knowledge of construction methods for light steel building methods. Be able to manage a variety of detailing activities with variable complexity of tasks and projects through to completion. Be open minded to explore new ideas and concepts, learn and implement any new or improved detailing methods or procedures. Customer service focused with the drive to follow up and pro-actively respond to current and potential customer or site issues. Spatial awareness skills with the ability to read drawings and be able to solve problems. To be successful you will have experience in light gauge steel industry. We welcome applications from candidates who have experience in the Australian construction industry or trades.

Preferably with 10 years field work experience as a structural engineer Expert experience in project management. Advanced knowledge of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations. Sound understanding of physics and mathematics. Three-dimensional conceptual skills. Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills. Analyze configurations of the basic components of a structure. Monitor and inspect all work undertaken by contractors to ensure structural soundness. Inspect properties to evaluate the conditions and foundations. Use computer-aided design technology for simulation purposes.

Primarily responsible in ensuring that it is completed with the Quality Standards set by the company, meeting the timelines and not exceeding the set cost budget that would ultimately result to our customer’s satisfaction TASK/RESPONSIBILITIES: To provide accurate measurements for façade, windows and doors of project and to coordinate this with the technical department for its accurate production or for sales quotation purpose. Assist in pull-outs and deliveries from company warehouse and suppliers to jobsites and vice versa. To effectively meet and process, Audit Job Orders, Production Orders, Material Orders in its entirety with Partners/Principal Suppliers and securing its precise delivery timelines. To perform PR works with supplier partners and its crew to enhance working relationships. Monitor’s fabrication and its workmanship, understands assembly procedures and performs quality control. Responsible in overseeing the anticipating the quantities needed for hardware fittings of W&D and orders in advance from our supplier. Monitor progress accomplishments per project and to file recommended percent of accomplishment for the timely release of payroll and for periodic reporting. Negotiate with Subcons for labor bids and its eventual award. Monitor Jobsite and Production shop for Material requirements to include tools, equipment’s and consumables. And facilitated its request for procurement. Prepares liquidations for its own expenses. Other pertinent paper works required for the project. Establishment of technical parameters with installers that will ensure the accurate and precise installation of façade, windows and doors Prepare the Sample and Mock-up Fabrication as per required by project or for presentation. Compliance village requirement for ingress egress. Compliance on manpower medical requirements. Attend Technical Meetings; with owners, general contractors, project managers, sub-contractors, and other persons related to the project. Quality Control upon pull-out , in-transit and delivery of raw materials and finish products Performs canvass and necessary field procurements for project requirements. Other duties assigned by Managing Director QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent. Undergrads of Architecture/Engineering fields are welcome to apply. Preferably with considerable number of years of experience working in a construction related industry At least 3-4 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position Preferably with experience working in glass facade or glass and aluminum windows & doors. Willing to render overtime when necessity arises. Driving skills, both 4 and two wheels. (MUST) CAN START ASAP!

JOB SUMMARY: Calculate a budget based on their client's requirements. Prepare detailed estimates to ensure the budget is sufficient for each stage of construction. The main task is to find out what a construction project will cost, including materials, labor, and services. DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION: A. TENDERING1. Attending Pre-bid conferences and gathering of information straight from the client.2. Conduct site inspection if necessary to ensure the accuracy of quantity surveying.3. Review and scrutinize the Bid Documents, Contract and Data sheets.4. Provide roughly estimate on what are involved in the project, based on measurements of the designer’s or client’s sketches. Comparison or an organized collection of Data Base/s from previous projects shall be done in order to predict the cost as accurate as possible.5. Study the architects’ and engineers’ plans, identify the costs (Labor, Materials, Equipment, etc.) involved, and then set an overall estimated budget for the project based on the given bid documents and data sheets. Compare the project with previous projects (see item #3).6. Coordinate with the clients for any clarifications through the Sales Group.7. Canvassing of materials and interact with the technical representative of suppliers for a clearer overview of the requirements. Review the Technical Data Sheets provided by the supplier (if necessary)8. Plan the costs to help the client stay within the project budget using practical solutions. In other words, perform Value engineering in any project being undertaken.9. Preparation of Technical Data sheets. 10. Prepare the final detailed estimate complete with cost analysis, manpower schedule, construction methodology in conjunction with Operations group and construction schedule based on the client’s target completion. This is the basis for the evaluation of the Engineering Manager for final selling. 11. Provides other related duties as may be required. B. AWARDED PROJECT (Construction works)1. Prepare to submit to the Document Controller all necessary documents for turn-over to Operations Group as follows:1.1 Detailed Material checklist.1.2 Technical Brochure and Data Sheets (from the suppliers) of materials based on the detailed material list.1.3 Construction, Manpower, Equipment and Tools Schedule.1.4 Cash flow data so the Operations Group can arrange the finances needed for each stage of the project.1.5 Minutes of the pre-bid meetings, site instructions, notes, pricing considerations, canvass sheets and or supplier’s quotations, cost analysis, raw files, tabulations, sketches and other related documents.1.6 Provide assistance to Operations Group for any variation orders. (if necessary)1.7 Provides other related duties as may be required. C. AWARDED PROJECT (Design works) 1. Provide assistance to the Design Engineer on Design, Quantity Survey, Technical Documentations and other related duties as may be required. QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. Willing to start immediately. Willing to travel to project sites mostly in Visayas and Mondanao. Two (2) Full-Time position(s) available.

Job Description About us Tungsten Structures are the best small firm in Australia and also the Australian building industry’s number one for value adding structural engineering, as recognised and awarded in 2020 by Consult Australia. Our focus is to always embrace our creative mindsets to achieve our greatest potential. By doing this we not only save our clients maximum construction dollars through contemporary, investigative and economical designs but we also produce highly innovative, engaging, and interactive documentation. We provide a more unique service offering to that of the robotic and generic one size fits all solution currently offered in the marketplace. We are fresh, our solutions are always considered, and we are fun to do business with. Tungsten Structures work together with our clients within loyal and exclusive relationships, to provide significant value to the lives and projects of all stakeholders involved. We are nationally recognised industry experts, specifically, for providing efficient and data rich industrial and retail sector structural engineering designs. About the role An exciting new opportunity is now available in our Manila office for a full-time (Monday-Friday 8am-4.30pm) experienced Senior Structural Steel Detailer with advanced skills in Tekla Structures. As we continue to expand on our fresh steel detailing service, the Senior Structural Steel Detailer will be influential in delivering exceptionally high quality steel detailing documentation to our clients. There is also a future growth opportunity to lead and contribute to the growth of our team of structural steel detailers and add valuable input into the continual improvement of our systems and processes. The Senior Structural Steel Detailer will work closely with the Associate Tekla Manager in Brisbane and report directly to our Philippine Tekla Manager who is working for Tungsten Structures from a private office in Bacoor City, Manila. This role presents an opportunity for a motivated and driven individual to take the next step in the steel detailing journey. Key activities include (but not limited to) Responsibility for checking 3D Tekla model from Engineering sketches and Architectural drawings. Resolve building geometry challenges by coordinating with Engineering and Architectural teams. Detail connections in Tekla in line to Australian standards. Resolve connection challenges by coordinating with engineers. Responsible for marking plan and shop drawing presentation. Involved in coordinating a detailing team to meet detailing schedules. Provide input in the continual development of steel detailing systems and processes. Experience required 10+ years’ experience with Australian projects, ideally industrial sector. 10+ years’ experience using Tekla Structures, experience with version 2019 or newer. Experience of Australian standards to implement in detailing. Strong understanding of Australian market proprietary products such as purlins and girts, handrailing. Experience with project management and leading small detailing teams. Your Capabilities Excellent written, verbal and listening skills in the English language. Be confident and efficient working with both autonomously and in a team environment. Goal orientated, the ability to work to deadlines and be flexible to adapt to changing client deadlines. High attention to detail. Identify and communicate problems and opportunities immediately. Actively participates in own learning and development. How to apply If this describes you then please apply now with BOTH your cover letter and resume/CV via the link. Please ENSURE you address the following questions in your cover letter otherwise your application will not be considered. Where do you currently live and how will you travel to Bacoor City everyday? Do you have immediate family in Manila, if so who are they? (ie wife, husband, children etc) What are your personal interests? Which Australian companies have you worked for? Which Australian projects have you worked on? What are your base salary expectations in PHP per month? Please attach recent examples from your portfolio to showcase to us your best work!

The primary objective is to develop superior risk management controls that ensure the safety of all stakeholders working on or near traffic. We do this with Traffic Management Plans, and Emergency Response Plans. The ideal candidate should have the following characteristics: Knowledgeable with RapidPlan basics - draw roads, add signs, implement distances, and use standard templates, as well as understand and utilise layers, icons, notes, and references. Must be knowledgeable on AutoCAD fundamentals demonstrating the ability to draw a basic road layout. Effectively use mapping tools (i.e. Google Earth, Street Directories, and Nearmap) to scope work area locations - understand mapping and topography and be able to look up latitude and longitude. Office 365 skills with a focus toward Outlook, Word, and Excel. Must be able to enter job data into tracking spreadsheet. Understand the need for standards and be able to lookup, apply, and reference standards and regulations. Understand the need for hazard control and prepare a basic risk assessment for a worksite. Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills. Have a keen attention to detail and accurately reference provided legislative requirements and technical manuals. Must be able to work in a team environment Can take client instructions and information and implement into risk controls.

Procurement Staff is responsible for the timely placement of purchase orders and delivery materials to meet customer order requirements and maintain stock inventory levels within approved guidelines at the project site. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Purchases assigned materials and services at the project site by employing the process of sourcing, canvassing, bidding, discussion of specs/work scope, negotiation, and evaluation/analysis of bids prior to making a recommendation and awarding of order. Performs, conducts and initiates value analysis, make-or-buy study, imported vs. local options, endorsement of substitute/alternative, and exploration of other options as needed that would be viable in the evaluation of the abstract of bids to come up with the best, if not the more appropriate recommendation. Performs order administration and logistics work with suppliers and requisitioners. Job Specifications: Graduate of any Bachelor’s/College degree. At least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field. Proficient in the use of SAP. Ability to negotiate with suppliers. Has a high sense of urgency and customer service. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office operations.

The Project Manager oversees all aspects of the planning, execution, monitoring and control of the overall operations of his assigned project. He/She is responsible in managing all contract negotiations, and successfully complete the project with the goal of meeting schedule, meeting quality standards, and staying within proposed gross margin projections while maintaining good customer and vendor relationships. Job Description: Provides managerial and technical supervision of the overall planning, execution, monitoring and control of the project activities. Directs the review and implementation of budgets, detailed schedules, work plans and manpower projections. Handles the organizing, staffing and updating of the project table of organization in coordination with HR. Ensures compliance with Company Policies/Procedure, Employee Code of Ethics and Conduct, and Corporate Governance. Job Specification: Must be a Licensed Civil or Electrical Engineer Preferably with formal training in Project Management Knowledgeable in PMBoK (Project Management Body of Knowledge) At least seven (7) years of relevant electrical experience in various structures such as buildings, infrastructure, industrial, power plants, especially in Transmission lines and Substations Willing to be assigned to any projects nationwide.

Job Title: Senior Technical Auditor (Operations and Construction Audit)
Job Description: QUALIFICATIONS: At least five (5) years of relevant industry / audit experience including two (2) years of project management experience Engineering Graduate and must be a Certified Engineer (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical) RESPONSIBILITIES: • Reviews the following:a. effectiveness by which risks are identified and managed;b. reliability and integrity of the financial & operational information and the business processes used to identify, measure, classify and report such information;c. adequacy of internal controls planned and in use, to safeguard the Company’s assets and operations;d. effectiveness of management controls which are meant to ensure the economic and efficient utilization of resources and to achieve the Company’s corporate vision and objectives; and,e. adequacy, existence and degree of adherence to Company policies, procedures and sound business practices.• Assists the Chief Audit Executive in reporting the results of audit activities in a manner that helps the management address the identified risk issues / concerns and take appropriate action within a reasonable period of time.• Appraises the adequacy of actions taken by the management in response to reported risk issues, control weaknesses and improvement opportunities.• Assists the Audit Committee in discharging their oversight function with regard to corporate governance. Such activities include establishing the communication channels to discuss with the Committee issues on financial reporting, risk management and compliance with laws, regulations and internal controls.• Coordinates with the Chief Compliance Officer in ensuring that the provisions of the Company's Corporate Governance Manual are appropriately and adequately complied upon.• Updates the Committee and Senior Management on developments and emerging trends in corporate governance both local and international, especially in areas directly affecting their roles and responsibilities.

Must be a licensed Civil/Mechanical/Electrical/ Engineer DRIVING SKILL is required FRESH GRADS are welcome to apply RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Manages and controls technical services for the assigned area to ensure high quality provision of water and used water services to customers, aligned to company guidelines and approved budget to ensure attainment of BA targets. 2. Conducts, analyzes, correlates, interprets water supply and pressure data and makes recommendations for effective Demand-Based Management of the assigned area. 3. Inspects, evaluates, estimates and makes recommendatory approval of water service connections applications and ensures proper implementation in accordance with MWCI specifications and standards. 4. Responds during incidents to uphold zero business disruption and ensure overall business continuity. 5. Assists in the Critical Activity Review (CAR) and Post Incident Review (PIR) to develop and document best practices, and make recommendations for systems improvement. 6. Evaluates work done by MWC contractors and provides recommendations for payment approval. Ensures quality of work and conducts audit completed of assigned job. 7. Responds to CRM technical tickets and field findings that require technical solutions as assigned by the Business Zone Technical Manager (BZTM). 8. Organizes control and participates in the execution, data gathering and analysis on benchmarking activities such as monitoring of pressure, water supply and water quality. 9. Organizes control and participates in the execution, data gathering and analysis on DMA activities such as Leak Localization, Step Testing, Water Adequacy Test (WAT), and Zero Pressure Test (ZPT). This includes rectification both for physical and commercial losses (e.g accounting of missing service connections that may cause NRW increase). 10. Accounts for and implements maintenance programs for appurtenances through constant evaluation and monitoring like during roads/drainages under construction to ensure business continuity

Qualifications: 1-2 years experience Experience in High-rise building projects Experience in Government projects (Documentations) Bachelor / College Graduate Full Time Knowledge in AUTOCAD With some experience is an advantage Scope of work: Quantity Surveyor Project costing/Estimate Will supervise construction works Perks/ Benefits: With allowance for motor gasoline in 1 week ( if available) With free load in 1 week

Duties and Responsibilities: Assist in the review of contractor’s drawings, method statements and test procedures to ensure compliance to requirements and project specifications. Coordinate and monitor mechanical activities of the project, including evaluation of construction methodology being implemented for the works. Prepares inspection reports and evaluates the results of quality tests conducted for each equipment, structure or system. Monitor and review actual project progress and accomplishments. If delays are observed, recommend catch-up scheme to ensure project schedules are met. Evaluates acceptability of the installations in reference to the design criteria. Perform quality control inspections to ensure compliance to project specifications and issue non-conformance reports as necessary. Coordinate and interface with other discipline or work stream to ensure appropriate planning and scheduling of works and resources. If necessary, attend regular meetings (ie daily, weekly, and monthly) to coordinat and resolve project issues. Monitor and ensures compliance of all contractors’ personnel to safety policies and procedures, environmental guidelines and security regulations. Conduct inspections to verify outstanding works or deliverables to the contractor for inclusion in the punchlist. Perform other project related works as maybe necessary. Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) or equivalent. At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): Mechanical Design Criteria, Drawing and method statements, Test Procedures Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent in a Power Plant Project Execution. Candidates must be open for 12-18 Months Contract Can Start ASAP

site works planning and implementation site works supervision and quality control willing to work and stay on site must have 2 years work experience in interior fit out supervision civil or architectural graduate with valid driver's license (added qualification but not required) computer literate (microsoft word, microsoft excel, etc.)

General scope: Construction/site monitoring, test and commissioning of a Geothermal Plant (including reliability run) support, - Deployment of multidisciplinary team at site (5 engineers >10 years experience), post EPC selection until project commissioning/commercial production. Scope includes site management, Inspections, QA/QC Control, interface management between all EPC Contractors etc. HSE, Project management and monitoring on behalf of owner, Test and commissioning support. List of Deliverables and responsibilities of the site engineer: Inspection reports including recommendations during construction phase at Tanawon Weekly and monthly reports Test and commissioning witnessing reports containing results, evaluation and recommendations Comments and recommendations on contractor’s project schedule (actual vs planned) and status reports Comments and recommendations on contractor’s method statements, inspection and test plan and testing & commissioning procedures FAT reports when requested by Client to witness equipment inspection and test at manufacturer’s shop Completion report including an executive summary, lessons learned and recommendations Other reports or documents that maybe necessary as part of the rendered service

Job Summary: The Project Engineer is responsible for the conduct and coordination of project tasks such as scheduling, budget preparation and monitoring, preparation of project specifications, review of proposals, permit acquisition and other related project development tasks to help meet the objectives and goals of the business development team. Scope and Responsibilities: Prepares technical specifications and requirements for projects in coordination with various groups and subject matter experts within the company. Conduct technical evaluation and review of proposals submitted by contractors, consultants or suppliers, including conduct of technical clarifications meetings. In coordination with various groups in the company, secure project permits and other regulatory authorizations or endorsements including the preparation of supporting documents such as project descriptions, drawings, calculations and others to support all permit applications. Prepare and regularly update the project schedule for reference during the development phase of the project until contract award or release of notice to proceed to the contractor or vendor Prepare the annual budget of a project, and handles the certification and processing of payments to contractors, consultants and vendors, including tracking of actual payments against contract cost. Collaborate with the project implementation team and the project manager to clearly define various interfaces for the project, including coordination with various stakeholders to gather inputs and scope recommendations. Prepare, secure, and gather all needed design inputs, specifications, and functional descriptions such as technical data sheets, layout drawings, equipment drawings, wiring diagrams, interface drawings, and other engineering documents in coordination with various groups and subject matter experts within the company. Conduct site visits to gather or verify project data, and accompany prospective contractors or vendor. Coordinates and handles the technical data gathering, queries, assessment, analysis and recommend required action during the conceptualization and feasibility stage of a project. Provide support and inputs during preparation, negotiation and finalization of contracts (ie EPC, Supply or BOP Construction Contract, etc.) to ensure that contract terms are aligned with the technical requirements Provide inputs and coordinate actions to mitigate risks and resolve issues as identified in the project’s risk register and issues log. Monitor the delivery of equipment by the vendor and handles the coordination with supply chain team and contractor’s logistics team/forwarder on customs releasing and delivery to site. Facilitate and attend regular huddles/coordination meetings with various teams to track progress and resolve issues and concerns related to the project. When assigned to a project site under construction, perform overall monitoring and quality control of the work (budget, schedule, plans, personnel’s performance), including periodic report on project status. Participates in the post-project review during closeout by sharing lessons learned and providing feedback and recommendations on various aspects of the project. Perform other tasks that may be assigned from time to time to support to the project Qualifications and Experiences: Candidate must possess at least Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Electrical Engineer At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Candidate Must at least 5-7 Years Project Management Experience Required Skill(s): Power Plant Development, Engineering Project Management, Construction or Project execution Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Others or equivalent.

Licensed Civil Engineer/Architect Perform technical plan review, including, but not limited to design and specification of commercial and residential construction plans (architectural, structural, plumbing, mechanical, electrical etc.) Ability to read plans, technical information and supporting documents, comprehend, and apply applicable construction codes Process with design professionals, contractors and owners Process good customer service skills and the ability to interact with the owners, contractors, and design professionals regarding the various construction codes Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in writing and verbally

Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. At least 1-4 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. Background with general building construction and plumbing is an advantage. Candidate must be willing to be deployed in Luzon Area. *Initial to final interview will be conducted online

Job Qualifications: Candidate must be a graduate of any Engineering course Knowledge in electrical and mechanical engine troubleshooting. Basic civil works, plumbing, mechanical and carpentry works Experience and familiarity in the operation of inverters, plc programming, scada, HMI, electronic scale, cctv and fire alarm system, instrumentation installation, maintenance and troubleshooting. At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Good command in MS application- Excel, Powerpoint, Word Good communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills Inspection of facilities / equipment / machineries and recommend action Multi-task related to: Building/Utilities/Electrical/Mechanical Job Responsibilities: Preparing, scheduling, coordinating, and monitoring of assigned engineering projects. Formulating project parameters and assigning responsibilities to the most capable employees and monitoring the project team. Interacting with clients, interpreting their needs and requirements, and representing them in the field. Performing quality control tasks on budgets, schedules, plans, and personnel performance and reporting on the project's status. Cooperating and communicating with the project manager and other project participants and collaborating with senior engineers to create more efficient project methods and to maintain the project's profitability.

Location: Las Pinas City, Makati City, Mandaluyong City, Muntinlupa City, Paranaque City, Pasig City, Taguig City
Job Description: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Update activities throughout the project Responsible for designing and constructing buildings and structures Responsible for improving the structural integrity of existing buildings Submit project reports and update status of project progress Review project specifications, technical drawings and variation request Monitor quality, ensure smooth work progress, controlling budget up to finalizing accounts JOB QUALITIES: Must have completed a Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering; a Licensed Civil Engineer Having Latin Honors is highly advantageous With outstanding scholastic and/or extracurricular achievements will also have an advantage (i.e. Board Topnotcher, etc.) With excellent interpersonal and communication skills Highly competent, self-driven and have passion for excellence Work experience in a Real Estate company is an advantage 1-3 years work experience in Structural is also an advantage Must be willing to work in Alabang/Las Piñas area Full time positions available

Responsible for the quality of civil engineering work performed, client service, utilization of staff, marketing, office reputation, contract management, billing collection, and project profitability for telecommunications engineering projects Directs and coordinates activities of Project Engineers to ensure project progresses in schedule and within prescribed budget. Performs work with the preparation of zoning and construction drawings Coordination with all complimentary disciplines: electrical, mechanical, structural and environmental, technical preparation of telecommunication design tasks and perform quality plan reviews Full managerial responsibility for all aspects of the project, scope, schedule, design, quality, etc. Maintains positive relationships with clients Supervises the design and ongoing progress of a project, including the coordination of the project with permitting agencies Control and effectively manage the subcontractors for the site construction, control over spend on sites which are to move outside the planned budget and ensure change is followed Reviews plans, prepares or reviews technical specifications, contract documents, and estimates Assures that project team complies with the contract agreement as well as exercises rigid cost control to implement the approved design within established budget restraints Other duties as assigned Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree, Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent With at least 5 Year(s) of working experience in Wireless Telecommunications preferred With at least 5 Years of progressive Project Management Required Skill(s): Civil Engineer, Structural (an advantage) must be a Licensed Civil Engineer Preferably Assistant Manager/Manager specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent Willing to work from Mondays to Saturdays Work assignment: Negros island

JOB ACCOUNTABILITY Ensures timely and complete submission of structural design and maintains structural quality through sound application of design principles. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Provides structural computations aligned with established design philosophy and strategy. 2. Reviews shop drawings and structural plans to ensure compliance with structural design parameters. 3. Ensures complete structural design documentation including plans and progress, validated results of material testing, site inspection, coordination meetings and other relevant information for ease of tracking and filing. 4. Assists in the research of existing and new material technology to determine practical applications, strength and durability expectations and cost-benefits information, and provides relevant information to enable the preparation of material recommendations for current and future projects 5. Performs other related structural tasks that maybe assigned from time to time. SKILLS AND QUALIFICATION 1. Licensed Civil Engineer 2. Knowledgeable in AutoCAD. 3. With working knowledge of National Structural Code of the Philippines, ACI and AISC codes.

At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Licensed/Accredited SO3, OSHC Safety Practitioner

Job Title: Site Civil Engineer for NGCP Substation/Transmission Line Project (Cebu)
Job Description: QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s / College Degree in Engineering (Civil) with Professional License. At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Substation and Transmission Line construction experience is an advantage. with COSH Certificate is an advantage. Required Skill (s): Computer skills, Strong Project Management skills, Good Time Management, Communication skills, Leadership skills, Commitment, Analytical skills and Technical skills. Knowledge in AutoCAD is an advantage. Preferably knows how to drive with driver's license. Candidates with own car or motorcycle will be prioritized. (Fuel allowance will be provided) Know how to handle and execute Manpower. Ability to coordinate more than one project at a time. Able to work in a fast-paced environment. CAN START IMMEDIATELY. One (1) Full time position. Preferably residents of Umapad/Pusok, Cebu Province. RESPONSIBILITIES: Supervision of projects assigned. Prepare, schedule, coordinate and monitor the assigned engineering projects. Monitors all related work activities and assigned tasks being done on the site based on work sequence and methodology. Interprets and executes plans and specifications. Change order and Variation order coordination. Make recommendations regarding the status of work. Assist in the preparation of work instructions. Coordinate with client and Subcon. Ensures that all subcontractor works are on proper execution and compliance. Ensure quality assurance and safety on-site. Ensures that progress is within expected guidelines and is completed on time and within budget. Report regularly on project status. Mentor project team members. Oversee the selection and requisition of materials. Resolve some unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise. Maintain high level of credibility, integrity and honesty. Perform other task which may be assigned by the supervisor/project manager.

Team member forming part of an International team co-ordinating Estimating Requirements. Compiling BOQ/Schedules. Computerised Quantity take-off and Calculations. Compiling and Co-ordination of Pricing packages (Suppliers and Sub-contractors) Team member forming part of an International team co-ordinating Estimating Requirements. Compiling BOQ/Schedules. Computerised Quantity take-off and Calculations. Compiling and Co-ordination of Pricing packages (Suppliers and Sub-contractors) Looking for Civil Engineering and or QS Bachelor degree qualified who can do Tender Procurement. This entails looking at drawings, specifications, and conditions of contract and compile Trade packages that can be send out to Suppliers and Subcontractors for quoting. Then co-ordinating the process of receiving Quotes. Almost an admin role, which require a technical background, hence degree requirement. Have leader potential. Looking for a potential Team Leader that can lead a few junior persons doing the same sort of work. Compensation package is flexible and can be adjusted according to the level of experience. We do not want a Team Leader to start with, but someone who has the potential to grow into the role. At least 5 year working Experience in related field of Civil Construction Industry Do not require any AutoCAD Skills. Need someone highly skilled in Excel. Although this role also entail doing Quantity take-off’s, it is done in non-CAD software tools, and tools that is widely used by Quantity Surveyors and very easily learned by any technical minded person. Any associated training to be provided for this.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: - Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Engineering (Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent. - Applicants must be willing to work in Taguig City. - with at least 1year of relevant experience in TV/HAV repair - Full-Time position(s) available. - with TESDA certifications and fresh graduates are encouraged to apply JOB DESCRIPTION: - On-site checking of defective dealer units - DAMS stock evaluation and cannibalization - On-call technician for very urgent field service VIP customers - Ad-hoc rework requirements - Board refurbishment - O-cell refurbishment
