PRC Required for this position Atleast 10 years experience as Project Manager in Construction Experience in government projects is an advantage Manages the over-all operation of the project • Prepares and monitors project budget • Prepares construction schedule and work methodology • Ensures that all construction works are executed in accordance with project specifications, budget, schedule and company policy. • Studies all project documents and prepares specific plans based on: a) Timing of materials delivery b) Timing of manpower complement • Conducts daily site inspections to ensure safety and quality of works

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Agriculture/Aquaculture/Forestry, Architecture, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. No work experience required. 2 Full-Time position(s) available.

JOB DESCRIPTION: 1. Schedule the project in logical steps and budget time required to meet deadlines. 2. Determine labor requirements and dispatch workers to construction sites. 3. Inspect and review projects to monitor compliance with building and safety codes, and other regulations. 4. Interpret and explain plans and contract terms to administrative staff and workers. 5. Obtain all necessary permits and licenses. 6. Direct and supervise workers. 7. Study job specifications to determine appropriate construction methods. 8. Select, contract and oversee workers who complete specific pieces of the project such as painting or plumbing. 9. Requisition supplies and materials to complete construction projects. 10. Prepare and submit budget estimates and progress and cost tracking reports. 11. Develop and implement quality controls programs. 12. Take actions to deal with the results of delays, bad weather or emergencies at construction site. 13. Confer with supervisory personnel, owners, contractors and design professionals to discuss and resolve matters such as work procedures, complaints and construction problems. 14. Plan, organize and direct activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities and systems. 15. Investigate damage, accidents, or delays at construction sites to ensure that proper procedures are being carried out. 16. Evaluate construction methods and determine cost- effectiveness of plans using computers. QUALIFICATIONS : 1. Candidate must possess at least Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering or equivalent. 2. At least five (5) years’ experience in contracting, engineering, project management, project execution or construction, and other related field 3. Skills and Training Required: Advance analytical and problem-solving, negotiation, contract bidding 4. Results focused and detailed-oriented, with good oral and written communication skills 5. With strong leadership skills, team player and able to multi-task 6. Proficient in computer software programs (ie MS Office) and project scheduling software (ie MS Project)

Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, with professional licensed is an advantage With 3 years’ minimum experience in Qa/Qc Perform and coordinate inspections and determine quality assurance testing models of raw materials and finished products. Prepare, document, and execute detailed test plans, test cases, and defect reports. Develop, document, and audit practices, program quality, and metrics reporting system. With driver’s license code 12 Preferably a resident of Davao del Norte

This role will supervise and monitor ongoing site-based projects and ensure that all activities are completed in a safe manner, within the allotted budget and time frame. It also supervises repair and maintenance of company facilities, ensuring smooth operation, sound physical condition, upkeep, and cleanliness of and its surroundings. The role shall also provide support to engineering in the development and implementation of engineering projects under Project Development and provides assistance in the review and monitoring of other work packages outside of the Department. Specific Personal Accountabilities: Sustainable Development Standards - Ensure effective use of the project’s safety and environmental standards and systems within own area of responsibility to positively contribute in nurturing the organization’s culture on safety and environmental management. Workplace Culture - Engage and support relevant customers, peers to help create a performance-driven workplace culture. This includes working cohesively with a multi-disciplined Project team. Leadership - Design, develop, and lead in delivering engineering projects for Tampakan. Develop and maintain high level of commitment towards project objectives and targets. Able to assess risk and take initiative and willingness to make decisions which are acceptable to the organization. And properly manage constraints and obstacles and still deliver work on a timely manner. Program Management - Assist in the effective implementation of all engineering plans and activities starting from the early works to construction and completion. Develop and maintain a culture of inter-departmental coordination to ensure implementation of all engineering activities is within timeline and budget. Compliance and Reportorial Requirements - Established controls, monitoring and coordination processes to ensure on-going compliance with relevant internal and external regulations and reporting requirements. Monitor and report engineering performance of all internal and external customers. Ensure accurate and timely delivery of required reports for internal reporting purposes. Provide the Team with technical study report required by National and Local Government Agencies to be submitted. Team Membership - Engage and support relevant peers in ensuring company’s programs, projects and major activities are effectively implemented in order to promote a positive and supportive partnership from Key stakeholders for the project’s economic sustainability objectives and targets. Cost Management - Ensure prudent and responsible cost management of activities within budget framework.

Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. Preferably with 4 years managerial experience in Construction & Repairs. Required Skill(s): Construction, Repairs Preferably Manager specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. Preferably with Professional License issued by the PRC With hands on experience in building construction and maintenance from a reputable organization. Job Responsiblities: Overseeing all onsite and offsite constructions to monitor compliance with building and safety regulations Reviewing the project in-depth to schedule deliverables and estimate costs Overseeing and directing construction projects from conception to completion

We are looking for Technical Applicators who are able to determine service needs and perform daily operational duty. They are responsible for the installation of various Waterproofing Treatment, Concrete Repair, Industrial Flooring, Tiling Solution, Etc. Qualifications: Vocational Graduate in Civil Technology Minimum of 1-2 years experience as Technical Applicator or any related work experience. Knowledgeable in waterproofing, concrete repair, industrial flooring, tiling solution, etc. Able to conduct product and project presentation, trainings, application and estimates. Adept in project management. Pro-active, enthusiastic and with good leadership qualities. Responsibilities – Technical Applicator (Field Operations) Must be able to interact and communicate well with clients in their projects and businesses; can understand operational procedures and identify various leakage problems. Install waterproofing treatment using equipment in accordance with established procedures and practices. Assist in waterproofing application and works with a range of waterproofing chemicals and coating products. Execute professionalism in waterproofing works Regularly monitor and maintain waterproofing equipment to ensure it remains in working order. Perform integrity testing and troubleshooting testing to identify any breeches or defects in the project’s existing waterproofing membrane/coatings. Perform visual inspections on projects. Exercise professional advice to client when required Other Duties Ensure all tools, supplies, and equipment are in working order, and arrange for replacements as necessary. Adhere to all health and safety practices and procedures. Adhere to all applicable laws and regulations, including building, trade, fire, and construction codes, as well as company policies. BENEFITS Shuttle service Meal subsidy Insurance benefit Others A very competitive salary package awaits the successful candidates.

Job Summary: The Project Superintendent’s responsibility is to supervise the field construction of a project and to complete the work on schedule, within the budget and to the quality of workmanship specified. In the performance of this function, it is the Project Superintendent’s responsibility to protect and promote company interests in all matters and to do whatever is reasonably necessary to discharge his duties and responsibilities which include, but are not necessarily limited to, the following:To provide leadership and to establish and maintain effective and harmonious working relationships of the on-site staff and to promote a positive project morale.To have a thorough and complete knowledge and understanding of the project contract, each subcontract, the contract drawings, specifications and addenda, and to assist the construction manager/ project manager & consortium (if any) in the development of the on-site procedures.To examine the contract drawings, specifications and addenda for design deficiencies, impractical details and possible code violations, and to bring these to the attention of the construction manager / project Manager who will review them with the consultant’s engineer.To assist the construction manager / project manager and the planning engineer in the development and refinement of the project schedule, and to work with the construction manager/project manager to keep the schedules properly updated, and to see that the job meets the various required dates.To plan and review the construction program with the construction manager / project manager in coordination with consortium (if any) including quality control, safety and security practices, field office location and layout, temporary utilities, staging areas, equipment and manpower.To coordinate, direct, monitor, and with the project engineers, supervisors and the technical coordinators, (project specific as required) inspect the activities of the subcontractors, suppliers and SCIC’s labor and material.To verify that each subcontractor has completed his contractual requirements as condition precedent to beginning his work at the project site. This includes a certificate of insurance, a fully executed subcontract, a schedule of values and a safety program.To assure that a sufficient supply of the proper SCIC report forms, site communication cell phones, camera, flashlight, measuring tape and other required incidentals are at hand.To see that all required permits or licenses have been obtained, and that a bulletin board is installed on which all required safety notices are posted.To cooperate with, and direct when necessary, the activities of the inspection agencies, and to effect remedial actions indicated by the reports of these agencies.To chair weekly coordination meetings and monthly safety meetings with the subcontractors and to issue typewritten minutes to the construction Manager / project manager as a result thereof.To receive and review the subcontractors daily reports of work done and labor and material employed.To review and check, on a weekly basis, all as-built prints.To review and check the Subcontractor’s monthly requests for payment prior to construction manager / project manager approval.To participate, as required, in the timely preparation of monthly requisitions to the owner and to see that they are promptly reviewed and approved by the client’s representative.To review and approve all time and material work vouchers and invoices prior to construction manager / project manager approval.To maintain good relations and communications with all involved in the project including the public.Performs other related job/duties as may be assigned by the management from time to time. Minimum qualifications: Should be a licensed civil engineer.Atleast 15 years in construction industry.should have experience working on a hydro project.management experience is a must.Can start ASAP.

Job Title: WANTED BEST QUANTITY SURVEYORS IN MANILA
Job Description: ATTENTION QUANTITY SURVEYORS, we are hiring again! Want to work with talented team on a powerful mission? 100% company paid health insurance (From day 1) Brand new computers and brand new office (Best modern office in Quezon city) Best software available to enhance your skill set. Please read this whole advert and follow the instructions within. Weight is applied to following these instructions. We read everyone personally so please take pride in your application. ABOUT US: We are an Australian based Quantity Surveying company specialising in producing Builders Bill of Quantities (BOQs). We are seeking 4 x more high quality. Quantity Surveyors to join our team working from our state of the art office based in Quezon City. We use the latest and most advanced software with the best IT support in a brand new office. We have 2 shifts: A morning shift 6am to 3pm and an afternoon shift 3pm to 12am Monday to Friday. Our team leaders work 9am to 6pm Monday to Friday. With this you commute time in peak hour is minimised. From time to time, yes we do work overtime, but you get paid for it. When you leave work we do not call you, email you nothing. We leave you to enjoy your time with your family and friends. In return we ask you commit to the team, focus to produce the quality work in the industry. Working and helping the team to succeed is paramount to us. The team is everything. WHAT WE DO: We produce the best Builders BOQs to the best builders on the East of Australia. We help builders by measuring ALL trades on a job they are tendering on. Our work is critical to their tendering process. They know from our work the quantum of materials and assists their subcontractors in submitting more accurate quotes quickly. We currently measure the best and largest building projects in Sydney and the East Coast of Australia. SKILLS: You must know how to read and interpret drawings, including Architectural and Engineering. Additional understand the logic finishes schedules and reports from consultants required to include with the BOQ. Knowledge in Cost X, Cubit and Global is a plus but not required. Knowing how to measure is mandatory. Knowing additional trades will assist your application though not paramount. Trades that we measure include the following: demolition, earthworks, civil, concrete, formwork, reinforcement, structural steel, roof, external walls (facades), internal walls (including partitions), ceilings, wall & floor finishes, metalwork, insulation, FFE, windows & doors, painting, joinery, external works incl landscaping. formwork, finishes trades etc per the list we have. You do not have to know all the trades but structure is paramount. If you can understand drawings, we can teach the right person with the right mindset or willingness to learn and grow how to measure and complete all trades per the Australian way.

Job Description: Primarily responsible for overseeing the safety and maintenance of designated properties and ensuring that these properties are in compliance with all applicable regulations. The Building administrator recommends improvements to the property as needed to ensure a safe, functional, and appealing space. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES : As Civil Engineer: Maintains, implement, or improve facilities, components, equipment products, or systems for industrial or commercial purposes;Carrying out feasibility studies for new technical innovations;Drawing up plans using computer-assisted engineering and design software;Estimates material and labor construction costs, and project timescales;Coordinates with technicians and crafts people and looks for contractors or technical providers for projects;Tests installations and systems, and analyzing data;Makes sure projects meet construction safety regulation and guidelines;Oversees inspection and maintenance programs;Attends meetings, writing reports and giving presentations to managers and tenants/clients;Perform other tasks that may be assigned by the management; As Building Administrator: Inspects the building and other structures frequently for signs of damage or wear and tear;Contacts/contracts professionals for building repairs as needed;Implements preventive maintenance as the need arises; General: Resolves any complaints, problems, and requests from building tenants;Insures that the tenant renovation / repair conform to the construction guidelines;Maintains a safe environment with proper lighting, signage, and Persons with Disability (PWD) access;Assists with emergency response and evacuations;Identifies customer requirements (especially in events area);Reads design specifications and technical drawings;Researches suitable solutions and estimates costs and timescales;Communicates with tenants/clients and contractors;Records, analyze and interpret test data;Supervises Maintenance staff;Implements monthly cleaning of drainage and other related sewage treatment facilities;Schedule Monthly Pest Control Application;Schedule quarterly Aircon Maintenance;Prepares Delivery receiving report;Prepares DCWD SOA for the tenants; and As Safety Officer (COSH) Implements and monitors on a timely basis the construction, occupational, health and safety of all staff/persons involved including the tenants and tanants’ customers. Qualifications: Education :Graduate of BS CIVIL ENGINEERING Experience :Preferably with at least 2 years experience Other Skills :Advanced computer skillsProficient autocad 2dBasic Autocad 3d / SketchupWith working experience in the construction an advantageWith Professional license and advanceAble to read building plans and schematic diagram.High attention to details and excellent analytical skills

Job Summary The Assistant Technical Training Manager shall provide support for the in-house technical training support arm of SMDC's Construction Management Department (CMD). This team provides corporate technical training and continuing education to SMDC employees that enhances mastery of job-specific skills and knowledge geared toward career progression. This will include but not limited to the following: Assist the Technical Training Head to plan, formulate and execute training programs for Planning and Engineering Facilitate Training and workshop that will enhance the capability of the Planning & engineering Personnel Record, Monitor and keep the technical training attendance and the individual performance as output of the training program Coordinate with Professional Regulation Commission and apply for the accreditation of the SMDC Technical Training Programs for CPD Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Architecture Registered Professional (PRC) Minimum 1 year work experience in Construction; Minimum 1 year experience in Seminar Facilitation or in a learning institution ( as an instructor / professor / trainer) Excellent communication skills. Demonstrates proficiency in computer and database software such as MS Word, Excel, and Powerpoint. Ability to plan, multi-task, and manage time effectively. Must be detail-oriented Work Location: Mall of Asia Complex, Pasay City

Job Title: Assistant Resident Engineer 2 (Rail Experience is required)
Job Description: Duties and Responsibilities: · Support the Senior Resident Engineer for smooth implementation of the Project for all design and construction issues related to civil substructure design. · Review all detailed civil sub-structural design and re--design from detailed designers or proposed by contractors. · Assist Senior Resident Engineer in appraising bids as part of the bid evaluation process in civil packages and in evaluating of the capacity of contractors. · Support Senior Resident Engineers to review Contractors’ civil substructure related method statement and construction plans. · Attend the periodical site inspection during construction and the defects liability period to resolve any civil substructure design and construction issues arising. · Assist Senior Resident Engineer to prepare a construction completion report, which will be a compilation and condensation of the data presented in regular monthly progress reports together with copies of as--built drawings. · Assist the Senior Resident Engineer in the preparation of BOQ by contract package for civil substructure works. Prepare method of measurement, and technical specification for the related item of BOQ. · Monitoring the contractor’s safety program for compliance with the construction contract requirements · Preparing neat and accurate diaries and photographs recording construction progression including thorough and accurate records of the contractor’s operations that Measure, calculate, and document quantities of installed materials in accordance with Project Representatives procedures, format and required computer programs · All other jobs assign by superior Qualification: · Candidate should be a graduate of Civil Engineering or equivalent. · Excellent working knowledge of industry practices/safety/quality management systems. · The candidate must have an experience in Railway Construction · High level of critical thinking skills. · High level of management skills. · Clear verbal communication skills. · Understanding of contract documents and specifications.

Job Description: Perform geotechnical analysis and study to assess construction site condition. Plan and conduct geotechnical exploration effectively. Perform field and environmental investigations for construction projects. Analyze geotechnical findings, perform appropriate calculations and prepare data reports to Manager. Duties and Responsibilities: · Oversee the day-to-day operations of the subcontractor for geotechnical surveys, both onshore and offshore · Ensure safety and quality of site operations of subcontractors · Develop proposals and determine cost and schedule for investigations. · Provide direction to technical team in field inspection activities. · Interact with customers and team members to complete the assigned project on-time. · Evaluate team performance and determine training needs to meet performance objectives. · Perform basic office administration tasks when needed. · Assist Manager in design and evaluation of constructions. · Develop design drawings and specifications for construction projects. · Review and approve geotechnical designs developed by outside consultants. · Review construction design proposals and approve geotechnical aspects. · Efficient and effective supervision and management of site geotechnical activities, inclusive of correct sampling procedures, the soil laboratory tests, the correct procedures in carrying out the pressuremeter, the PS logging, the CPTu, and the application of gINT8i software in data processing. Qualification: · A degree is necessary for entry to this career. Relevant subjects include: o engineering geology o geology o geophysics o geotechnology o mineral/mining engineering. · At least 10 years experience · Supervision of at least two On-shore and at least one Off-shore geotechnical survey for an infrastructure project

Responsibilities:· Inspect project sites to monitor progress and ensure conformance to design specifications and safety or sanitation standards.· Estimate quantities and cost of materials, equipment, or labor to determine project feasibility.· Provide technical advice to industrial or managerial personnel regarding design, construction, or program modifications or structural repairs.· Compute load and grade requirements, water flow rates, or material stress factors to determine design specifications.· Plan and design transportation or hydraulic systems or structures using computer assisted design or drawing tools.· Direct or participate in surveying to lay out installations or establish reference points, grades, or elevations to guide construction.· Design energy efficient or environmentally sound civil structures.· Prepare or present public reports on topics such as bid proposals, deeds, environmental impact statements, or property and right-of-way descriptions.· Test soils or materials to determine the adequacy and strength of foundations, concrete, asphalt, or steel.· Conduct studies of traffic patterns or environmental conditions to identify engineering problems and assess potential project impact.· Identify environmental risks and develop risk management strategies for civil engineering projects.· Develop or implement engineering solutions to clean up industrial accidents or other contaminated sites.· Analyze manufacturing processes or byproducts to identify engineering solutions to minimize the output of carbon or other pollutants.· Design or engineer systems to efficiently dispose of chemical, biological, or other toxic wastes.Qualifications:· Graduate of Civil Engineering· Licensed civil engineer· Must have at least 7 years of actual site experience in horizontal and/or vertical construction (those with experience especially in residential subdivision land development and residential and commercial building construction will be given top priority. Land development may encompass road preparation and concreting, drainage network construction, water supply systems, clearing and grading earthworks, construction of low-, medium-, and high-cost housing, etc.);· Must be a highly organized and detail-oriented individual able to execute effective construction and project operations management at land development and building construction sites. Must be able to implement best practices in general construction and engineering operations;· With experience in railroads· Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office applications;

Responsibilities: Designing and constructing buildings and structures that are safe and capable of withstanding the elements to which they will be exposed, as well as improving the structural integrity of existing buildings. Coordinate with Project Architect / Designer to determine the structural requirement for each project (including permit documents) Lead the Modular Engineering Team from Light Gauge Steel (LGS) design, production, assembly, erection, materials planning and admin function (documentation, billings, etc) Plan, direct, coordinate, budget, and perform activities concerned with the putting up or repair of a building structure (other than LGS Structure) Effectively convey information in various forms (verbal, written, etc) in a clear and concise manner within or outside the organization Directs the Engineering Modular Team and assign scope of works to respective subordinates Conduct site inspection / assessment and provide evaluation to determine the status of the project Meet the clients need and provide them information that is important to them regarding the projects Consolidate and check weekly accomplishment reports from subordinates Submission and presentation of project accomplishment to superiors and clients Facilitate coordination meetings to discuss updates and problems that may arise during the course of a project Monitor and collate all structural cost Evaluate the cost efficiency level of estimate vs the actual project cost Formulates recommendation for value engineering NOTE: Should be willing to saty in Bulacan (Plant) Enable GingerCannot connect to Ginger Check your internet connection or reload the browserDisable in this text fieldRephraseRephrase current sentenceEdit in Ginger×

Job Title: Geodetic Engineer - Cebu (Must be Licensed) NEEDED ASAP
Job Description: Qualifications: -Candidate must be a graduate of Geodetic Engineering and a licensed Geodetic Engineer -With at least 6 months of related survey works -With experience in isolated surveying and geodetic works -Proficient in using different survey equipment -Can work independently or with a team -Willing for a project based employment -Willing to be relocated to Metro Manila or nearby provinces Duties:-Assigned in the project site.-Responsible for conducting surveying activities in the construction site.-Ensure that surveying activities follow the IMS guidelines.-Supervise and ensure safety of the surveying team, coordinate the pre-development activities and interpret survey information.

Job Summary: The Project Site Engineers will work closely with the Project Manager in the planning and execution of the construction and installation of PV Solar Panels in the entire projects of the organization. General Duties and Responsibilities: Ensure the installation of solar projects are executed according to approved timeline, budget, safety and technical standards. Ensure proper resources management (Procurement and Logistics). Develop and execute plans for quality construction implementation and audit. Develop project schedule according to approved plans and contract. Manage client engagements during implementation phase. Manage manpower and contractor work progress and performance. Qualifications and Skills Requirement: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree/Licensed in Engineering (Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent. With at least three years of solid experience working in the field as Project Engineer for SOLAR PROJECTS is required in this position. Knowledgeable in the Monitoring, installation, testing and operation of solar PV systems. With adequate know how in using Microsoft Office and AutoCad. Team player and with excellent oral and written communication skills.

Parker Black & Forrest has long been regarded as the benchmark in providing architectural hardware specification and supply services within the Western Australian construction market. This well established business, consisting of 40+ committed staff are looking to expand into a new and exciting market segment. This new business unit will be run under the Parker Black and Forrest brand, but have its own business goals, expectations, staff and high standards. The initial team of three will be highly motivated, flexible, adaptable and solutions driven. This is a new business unit looking to disrupt a market segment, everything that we do will be for the first time so only the brave and courageous need apply. The team will have two staff members based in Perth focusing on project delivery and management and an estimating role based in the Philippines that is critical to the growth and success of the business unit. If you are an experienced Estimator that the craves being apart of a fast moving, exciting and motivated team that rewards effort, this is an ideal role to get in on the ground floor of an expanding company as they build their operations in Manila. Apply Now! MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES Review tender documents stored in online portals and extract relevant information, plans, specifications and design briefs in readiness for estimating;Maintain accurate project databases in line with standard company procedures;Create accurate bill of quantities inline with floorplans and design briefs;Review and evaluate cost estimates;Communicate with trade partners and team members on projects;Prepare and issue purchase orders;Understand scope and design brief requirements;Manage tender pricing framework;Assist in final contract negotiations;Provide input into project forecasting;Check completed work for accuracy and make required edits immediately;Assistance in the preparation of final tender submission pages and documents;Maintain a project database and CRM system;Do whatever is needed to provide a solution to our construction partners. SKILLS & EXPERIENCEEducational Background: Quantity surveying/construction management degree Experience: 3-5 years in an estimating role is preferred but motivation, energy and a desire to do great things will be highly regarded SKILLS Must be comfortable working in a highly motivated team environment that puts solutions before all else;Advanced Microsoft Office Skills (Excel, Word);Excellent verbal and written communication;Organised and has ability to understand and meet deadlines;Quick, efficient and accurate typing and data entry skills;Attention to detail;Motivated by continuous improvement;Experience in drafting or design software;Ability to maintain confidentiality. PERFORMANCE GOALS Complete estimating tasks in line with required deadlines;Complete all works with a high level of accuracy and on time;Deal with clients, suppliers, architects and internal PBF team professionally at all times;Provide a solutions first outcome to all tasks;Contribute in a meaningful way to departments continuous improvement;Contribute to business growth;Ensure work area is clean and tidy at all times. Genuine Career opportunity with attractive benefits await! Above industry standard compensation;Dayshift 8.30am – 5.30pm;Career growth within an industry leader;Great team culture and modern working environment;Prime location in EMPATA office and access to top of the line facilities and technologies;HMO coverage including 1 dependent or mutual fund benefit and life insurance coverage upon regularization;20 leave credits per year consumed at your discretion;Exposure to world class, high level management from foreign direct superiors;Employee engagement activities;Unlimited gym access (SFS and PNB office).

PERFORMANCE GOALS Complete estimating extraction tasks in readiness for estimating team within a timely manner;Complete data entry tasks with a high level of accuracy and on time;Deal with clients, suppliers, architects and internal PBF team professionally at all times;Provide a solutions first outcome to all tasks;Contribute in a meaningful way to departments continuous improvement;Ensure work are is clean and tidy at all times. Genuine Career opportunity with attractive benefits await! Knowledgeable in using Revit is an advantage. Systematically save drawings on our cad server, keeping the server organized, updated project folders and files as progress drawings and revisions are made.

Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree College Graduate or Associates degree in related field with work experience Excellent communication, leadership, and organizational skills. Exceptional time management and verbal and written communication skills Ability to handle workers effectively Familiarity with basic MS Office / Excel Professional manner and strong ethical code Ability to multitask and remain motivated and positive Commitment to working efficiently and accurately Exceptional Character At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): Supervise on going projects of the following: Concrete Floor Polishing, Paving Blocks, General Painting, Floor Painting, Fencing A Vaztech Corp Project Site Coordinator is an administrative and field professional that performs the following tasks: a) Oversees all on-going projects of the company relating to each ones activities, resources, equipment and information b) Responsible for coordinating all labor needs for a given project which involves picking internal team members/workers as well as suggest hiring and training of external labor when necessary c) Create and deliver project instructions to all team members/workers. d) Regular site visits to all on-going projects to make sure any issues are handled with care e) Make certain that client needs are met as each project evolve f) Monitor and track each project’s progress by sending photos with work completion on every visit g) Prepare weekly payrolls, budget and schedules for each project h) Administer Petty Cash Fund for all projects i) Act as the point of contact and communicate project statuses adequately to management j) Report and escalate to management as needed k) Plan ahead to prevent problems and resolve emerging ones l) Analyze and manage mitigating risks m) Set performance standards at project sites, evaluate quarterly and report findings and recommendations to management n) Performs any other duties assigned by the senior officials of the company The main responsibility of a Project Site Coordinator is to ensure all projects are running smoothly, on time and within budget. Preferably Licensed Engineer with 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. CAN START ASAP

KNOWLEDGE/EDUCATION Candidate must possess A Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering and is a Licensed Professional Civil Engineer EXPERIENCE At least 2 – 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 years experienced in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. COMPETENCIES Strong organizational, analytical, and writing skills to include solid experience in writing functional and technical specifications. Has the capability to prepare all levels of project schedules, monitor progress, and ensure that milestones are met. Has the ability to present project schedule to management and to prepare recovery plans in case of schedule slippage. Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability in work style to better respond to multiple requests/tasks and handles sudden changes in priorities. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES Prepare, monitor, update and revise construction schedule. Work closely with Project Manager and Designers to develop and maintain detailed resource-loaded scheduled design/building construction projects. Monitors the accomplishments at the project sites and analyses their effect on the project schedule Prepares the methodology applicable to existing/actual site condition and its required resources Gather and analyze information to prepare reports on the progress of projects. Support the Project Management Team in planning, tracking, analysis, and reporting of project status. Coordinate and work with the Project manager to resolve project issues to ensure the delivery/completion of the project work Attend weekly staff and monthly division meetings. Prepare weekly accomplishment report. Perform other duties in relation to the primary function as assigned.

Responsibilities Include: • Analyze blueprints and other documentation to prepare time, cost, materials, and labor estimates. • Assess cost effectiveness of products, projects or services, tracking actual costs relative to bids as the project develops. • Consult with clients, vendors, personnel in other departments or construction foremen to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues. • Confer with engineers, architects, owners, contractors and subcontractors on changes and adjustments to cost estimates. • Prepare estimates used by management for purposes such as planning, organizing, and scheduling work. • Prepare estimates for use in selecting vendors or subcontractors. • Review material and labor requirements, to decide whether it is more cost-effective to produce or purchase components. • Prepare and maintain a directory of suppliers, contractors and subcontractors. • Set up cost monitoring and reporting systems and procedures. • Establish and maintain tendering process, and conduct negotiations. • Other related duties as may be required. Job Requirements: • Must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, preferably a licensed Civil Eng’g or Mechanical Eng’g. • At least five (5) years of related experience. • Background in metal works and fabrication a plus. • With extensive experience in making project cost estimates. • Excellent knowledge of design and visualizations software such as AutoCAD. • Advanced MS Office skills. • With strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Must be keen on details and highly organized. • Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree required in engineer or business-related field At least 10 years of recent experience in the related field preferably in Construction Industry Knowledge in Heavy Equipment and logistics Excellent time management, planning, and organizational skills. Solid leadership skills and ability to create and foster a team environment. Excellent oral and written communications skills, as well as good listening skills. Excellent organizational skills and ability to work under pressure. Proven analytical skills. Exceptional customer service skills and the ability to maintain an excellent working relationship with internal and external customers. Self-motivated with the ability to perform independently. Ability to identify and seek needed information. Ability to think strategically. Demonstrate a positive attitude, maturity, initiative and integrity with a professional image Work effectively in a team environment. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Handles the Heavy Equipment Services and Logistics Operations support Ensures Vehicle and Equipment Maintenance and Repair

Doing assessments and site inspections. Preparing and implementing project plans. Researching and providing estimates for projects. Monitoring and optimizing safety procedures, production processes, and regulatory compliance. Making recommendations or presenting alternative solutions to problems. Project management duties (e.g. managing budgets, resources, and deadlines; acquiring and compiling quotes, etc.).

Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Knowledgeable in supervising Horizontal project such as Roads, Bridges, Pipelaying etc,. Overall supervision of field activities and conduct toolbox meeting to address problems within your subordinates. Prepare a schedule of activities, list of equipment of each activity, daily activities report, weekly work projection, and check all materials and equipment available at the site. Good communication skills. Strong personality.

Design Group Perform the design of various office, commercial, residential, institutional and industrial projects; Perform project coordination and attend to design coordination meetings; Perform data collection and site visits to determine the actual site conditions; Perform actual site as-built surveys and prepare as-built drawings; Prepare the basis of design, design drawings, technical specifications and cost estimates; Prepare various technical reports as required during the design process; and Perform site inspections during construction and prepare corresponding inspection reports. Project Management Group Perform project/construction management of various vertical and horizontal projects; Prepare technical design, working drawings, specifications and contract documentations, including commercial conditions; Prepare work schedules and programs using bar charts or PERT-CPMs; Perform quantity surveying including material and quantity take-off and cost estimates; Perform actual site as-built surveys and prepare as-built drawings; Perform project coordination and attend to site construction meetings; and; Perform periodic site inspections and prepare monthly progress reports. Qualifications: Candidates must be Licensed Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics or Sanitary Engineers. With 5 to 20 years of work experience preferably from a reputable consultancy or construction firm. Computer literate using MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, AutoCAD and applicable design software. With excellent academic records and preferably active in various professional organizations. ISO:9001 background will be an advantage. For scheduled interviews, kindly bring your updated resume, recent photo, and photocopies of the following: Transcript of Records, PRC License, Board Rating, and Board Certificate and other pertinent credentials. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES o Devising projections, diversions and anticipations of work priorities for continuous and effective cycle on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. o Develop and organize the project execution plan. o Develop a crashed program or catch up schedule if needed. o Plan and manage the efficient utilization of company assets and resources. o Supervise constructions activities and ensure timely completion of project. o Monitors budget and implements cost effective measures. o Ensure compliance to company quality and safety standard. o Prepares and submits necessary documents and reports required by the Management. o Prepares and submit Project Status Report. o Monitors the progress and effectiveness of the project. o Ability to set and be accountable for project deadline. o Capability and willingness to perform Inspection of the jobsite condition. o Responsible for communication and monitoring of contractors in terms of their performance and deliverables. o Directs activities and facilitates coordination between contractors, engineering, warehouse, suppliers, client and other concerned Department. o Provides the Management and Technical Support probable solution to problems encountered at site. o Conducts regular project review and reporting of project status & requirements to top management. RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: o Project-In-Charge (P.I.C.) of the Project o Gives instructions to all workers involved in the Project o Reports to the Project Manager all project concerns needing immediate attention. DOCUMENTATION: o Review and Submit Accomplishment Reports o Review and Submit Schedule Update o Review, evaluate, monitor and submit Subcon and Supplier Billings, requisition of materials, bill of quantities and bill of materials o Review and Submit Tabulation of Change Order o Review and Submit Request for Information (RFI) when necessary o Review and Submit Request for Approval (RFA) when necessary o Review and Submit Concrete Pouring Request (CPR) before actual concrete pouring o Monitor and Submit Logbook of Daily Contractor’s Report (for Occupancy Permit) o Monitor the Weather Chart Daily TECHNICAL o Continually reviews Technical Plans, anticipating conflicts with the plan (if any) o Attends coordination meetings with the Owner and Construction Manager o Coordinates and works closely with the Construction Manager regarding all project concern. o Coordinates with the Office Engineers regarding Procurement Plan o Double Check Estimates various project material needs o Monitor & Follow up on material/equipment to ensure timely response to action items o Schedule and monitor program of activities to achieve an “on-time” result. PROJECT CONTROL o Monitoring of materials (Concrete, Filling Materials, CHB, etc.) o Handles all DLCCC Sub Contractors 1. Gives Sub Contractors Site Instructions 2. Accomplishment Monitoring 3. Progress / Weekly Billing o Coordinates with the AutoCAD Operator in Preparing Shop Drawings / As- Built Drawings ADMINISTRATIVE o Concerned on all administrative matters related to the project including security, safety, quality control, housekeeping and other matter. o Checks the weekly Daily Time Record (DTR) prepared by the Timekeeper. o Assures the proper implementation of Company Policy inside Project Site. o Investigates all problems encountered on-site. o Approval of the use of Project’s Petty Cash. o Investigates and helps resolve conflicts among site personnel. o Discuss safety & health related matters with the Safety Officer regularly. o In the absence of project engineer, the Project- In-Charge shall be responsible to cover all Site Operation related matters. o Other tasks that may be assigned by the Management from time to time.

JOB SPECIFICS: Manages and coordinates all aspects in different phases of the project. From the land development, pre-construction stage, construction stage up to post-construction stage. Responsible in construction feasibility studies, planning strategies, planning presentation, and community engagement. Representative on the construction team, responsible for monitoring construction progress and schedules, reviewing all materials submitted for approval. Must have firsthand knowledge of all activities in the project, inclusive of the various aspects of the project operation as to: scheduling, planning, programming, quantity surveying, monitoring, cost control, quality assurance/control, safety, administration, housekeeping, security and logistics. Must be able to prepare a detailed construction schedule and construction budget of all the projects being undertaken. The detailed schedules or work plans shall identify the sequences of the activities needed to successfully implement and complete the project. Discuss, define and review the scope of the project and the project schedule and budget with the Vice President for Technical, propose and introduce changes/revisions to further improve the project implementation, and shall prepare reports on the project for management information, review and assessment. Shall manage the engineering and construction team according to the established policies, rules and regulations of the company. Shall effectively communicate and coordinate project related matters with the Technical Design Department, sub-contractors, contractors, suppliers, consultants, clients, the community and the local government units. Shall make decisions in the project based on approve plans, drawings, specifications, on good and sound construction practice. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Licensed Civil Engineer At least ten (10) years of extensive experience in real estate construction with advanced knowledge in project management. At least ten (10) years’ experience in high rise and mid-rise building and residential engineering and construction projects as well as land development projects. At least ten (10) years’ experience in a managerial capacity specialized in Engineering and Construction. Exceptional knowledge in land development, construction scheduling, works/activities, manpower, equipment and logistics, quantity surveying, construction budget, bill of materials, bill of quantities, quality assurance, quality control, value engineering, preparation of technical reports, monitoring reports, accomplishment reports, cost reports and correspondence. Exceptional knowledge of all works in the project, very articulate, very particular to details, can effectively analyze, review and evaluate any project related matters, technically sound individual and can keep pace with the latest technologies in engineering and construction.

Project Engineer Job Responsibilities: Completes engineering projects by organizing and controlling project elements. Develops project objectives by reviewing project proposals and plans and conferring with management. Determines project responsibilities by identifying project phases and elements, assigning personnel to phases and elements, and reviewing bids from contractors. Determines project specifications by studying product design, customer requirements, and performance standards. Completes technical studies and prepares cost estimates. Confirms product performance by designing and conducting tests. Determines project schedule by studying project plan and specifications, calculating time requirements, and sequencing project elements. Maintains project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, and resolving problems. Controls project plan by reviewing design, specifications, and plan, scheduling changes, and recommending actions. Controls project costs by approving expenditures and administering contractor contracts. Prepares project status reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends; recommending actions. Maintains safe and clean working environment by enforcing procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains project data base by writing computer programs; entering and backing up data. Maintains product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Project Engineer Qualifications / Skills: Requirements analysis Design skills Project management Manufacturing methods and procedures Process improvement Technical understanding Documentation skills Safety management Supervision CAD, CAD/CAM circuit design Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or other related discipline required 3+ years of project experience working as a Civil Engineer in the construction industry is required PRC License is a plus Proficient with MS Office, Auto Cad, and other related computer applications

Job Responsibilities: Manage structural design works, research applicable design criteria, attend project meetings, communicate with members of the project team, and report progress to the Design Coordinator. Coordinate all technical and administrative elements of each allocated design project to ensure all work is delivered in a professional, effective, and efficient manner while applying sound engineering principles. Deliver innovative, sustainable, efficient, safe, practical, and intelligent structural engineering solutions on all projects and other activities, appropriate to the stage and type of project. Perform design and analysis functions for various structures. Conduct assessments and evaluations of existing structures. Develop solutions to challenges within budget, schedule, and project constraints. Ensure the overall stability of designs in the permanent/final condition as well as during construction. Ensure health and safety are considered at all stages of the design process such that the designs produced minimize risk during construction while exceeding the client’s expectations. Prepare drawing packages for all stages of projects from Basis of Design, Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents, and Contract Administration. Ensure quality and efficiency for assigned tasks and deliverables. Actively work on high-level tasks and deliverables for multiple projects simultaneously. Prepare for regular project team meetings pertaining to project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Review shop drawings and samples to ensure drawings and finishes match specifications. Revisit designs and make adjustments to designs as needed. Liaise with various professionals and departments to coordinate project details. Qualifications: A Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering Must have a current license to practice from the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC). Accredited and a member of their respective profession’s organization. Well-versed in international and local codes, standards, and regulations. Decisive with excellent critical thinking skills. Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Good written and verbal communication abilities, including preparing and giving presentations. Proficient in STAAD, Autodesk Revit Structural, BIM 360 Cloud, and other structural analysis software. At least 5 years of experience in design and construction projects. Must be willing to work on-site.

The QA/QC Manager is responsible for supervising and monitoring Quality Assurance / Quality Control, Schedule Control, Construction Site Safety and Site Coordination of construction projects. The QA/QC Manager shall monitor day-to-day activities of QA/QC Inspectors, Project Planner/Scheduler, Safety Engineer, contactors and sub-contractors assigned to construction projects, both building and civil related. This job responsibility includes ensuing that all project construction is conducted consistently with the construction documents, applicable building codes, good workmanship, and QA/QC requirements. The QA/QC Manager role includes direct oversight and review of the entire documentation and physical inspection phase of the work flow process and working with other in-house personnel (e.g. Project Managers, Engineers, Superintendents, etc.) and external personnel to produce and document a quality product. The QA/QC Manager reports directly to the CLIENT for the sake of assuring that a conflict of interest does not occur among the productivity, schedule, and the quality objectives of the project. The QA/QC Manager must be alert in detecting, recording, and reporting any deviation from approved construction documents, including calling any deficient item to the attention of Project Manager, contractors, and/or other representatives. The QA/QC Manager must keep accurate and detailed records of Contractor's performance and progress, delivery of materials, and other pertinent matters, including the daily work journal and inspection reports.

CONSTRUCTION OPERATIONS MANAGER v JOB BRIEF Construction Operations Manager performs various functions in ensuring effective planning and supervision of construction projects. Oversee projects as they are carried out to make sure that the work is done according to outlined specifications, and that can also conform with project timetable. v GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES · Coordinates all facets of construction to meet overall organizational goals for operations including Site Prep, Volunteer Services and Special Projects. Manages interdepartmental communications and meetings so that Construction functions within the team. · Coordinates development layout activity with construction staff. · Check and verify materials specification used in bidding estimates. · Provide consistency in decision making across the projects. · Ensure the quality and timeliness of the delivery of outputs and that all Heads and personnel are suitably informed to properly carry out duties. · Manage complete reporting system · Support the engineering and technology management capabilities of the company. · Proactively asses future obstacles and coordination issues in advance of the contractors and consultant in order that solutions are available before issues become critical. · Identify and address risks especially for potential claims. · Make sure that Heads is provided with necessary guidance to proceed correctly. · Implement and oversee safety and Quality (ISO System) Standards and Procedure. v JOB REQUIREMENT · Experienced in Precast / Prestress / Pile Driving / Board Piling · Minimum of 8 – 10 years in Construction Management with increasing levels of responsibility. · Licensed Civil Engineer is preferred · Team player with excellent personnel management skills and capacity to build a strong departmental team. · Experienced in working with planning documents, CAD drawing of bridge plans, some design experience helpful. · · With good or fair communicative skills towards superiors and co-workers. · Demonstrate the core values of HRD: Honesty, Initiative, Resourcefulness, Dynamism. · Can travel to different area v JOB SNAPSHOT · Base Pay - 70,000 – 100,000 · Employment - Full-Time · Job Type - Construction Operations Manager · Education - 5 years · Experience - 8 - 10 years · Work location - Aguan del Sur / Quezon City

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES · The job entails the performance of civil engineering and site operations management functions for the planning and actual construction and site development of warehouse building · The job may require construction quantitative accomplishment appraising, quality control and audit, project cost estimating, working plan analysis and review, workflow and/or selected property management functions and administrative support; · Knowledgeable in preparation and evaluation of billing. · Prepare and review plans and estimates scopes of works for the projects. · Monitors construction works and ensure that all guidelines are strictly follows. · The job is supervisorial and requires leadership ability. JOB QUALIFICATIONS ﻿· Candidate must be a LICENSED CIVIL ENGINEER. · Must have at least two to three (2-3) years of actual site experience in warehouse building construction or other related field. · Candidate must have experience in land development and warehouse building construction. Also, in residential and commercial building construction. Development may encompass road preparation and concreting, drainage network construction, water supply systems, clearing and grading earthworks, etc. · Must be a highly organized and detail-oriented individual able to execute effective construction and project operations management at land development and building construction sites. · Must be able to implement best practices in general construction and engineering operations; · Must be already capable and qualified, or has the potential and willingness, to work in a supervisorial capacity at assigned actual project site. Must also be able to perform related planning and documentation functions. Periodic office/ tablework is required; · Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office applications; · Must be effective in interacting with all project stakeholders (contractors, workers, regulatory bodies and inspectors, suppliers, property buyers/ owners, etc.) · Willing to accept project-based engagement. · Must be willing to assigned in provincial area specifically in Pangasinan.

The Assistant Cost Engineering Manager is responsible for the review and monitoring of the Construction Costs and Percentage of Completion (POC) of her assigned projects. She works together with the Cost Monitoring Team for the generation of the Monthly Consolidated Cost Monitoring Report. She assists the Cost Engineering Manager on all cost monitoring and project schedules concern. Oversees and monitors compliance on the timely submission of Monthly Reports and periodic Percentage of Completion (POC) Certifications of her assigned projects Assists the Cost Engineering Manager in the collection, review and monitoring of the Percentage of Completion (POC) Certifications of all projects for the generation of the Consolidated POC Summary Report (including Project S-Curve Schedule’s monitoring and EOT (Extension of Time) monitoring) Reviews the Cost Monitoring Reports and Change Order Reports of her assigned projects (including the monitoring of Supplemental Budgets, Budget Transfers, Consultancy Fees, etc.) and works together with the Cost Monitoring Team for the generation of the Consolidated Cost Monitoring Report Assist in the compilation of the Consolidated Cost Monitoring Report Coordinates and reconciles all cost monitoring & POC concern of her assigned projects to the Construction Management Division (e.g. Project Managers / Officers / External Construction Managers), and Accounting Department Monitors and reviews Change Orders of her assigned projects for endorsement Performs other duties that may be assigned from time to time. Job Qualifications and Skills Required Bachelor’s Degree in any Engineering field from a reputable College or University Experience in Quantity Surveying, Estimating and Cost Engineering / Monitoring with PRC License an advantage 5 to 10 years working experience in Quantity Surveying / Estimating / Cost Engineering / Cost Monitoring / Change Orders Monitoring Computer Skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); SAP (advantage) Team player, responsible, reliable

Key Responsibility: Preparing, managing, and maintaining schedules, progress and reports. Coordinate with all project department to collate project requirements and ensure the integration of the program. Preparation of various project schedule studies and assess the impact to the Contractual Baseline Program & Internal Program. Responsible for anticipating potential delays and highlighting slippage during the progress. Functional Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor Degree preferably in Engineering. (with PRC license is an advantage) Minimum of 5yrs. experience in construction industry (Railway, Roads & Bridge project is an advantage) Knowledge of the concept of design deliverables and the planning of typical design submission and approval process. Primavera P6 practical experience is essential, and knowledge in TILOS is an advantage. Proficient in MS office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) for project reports & presentations. Able to prepare level 1 up to detailed schedule with complete resource loading, project coding, histograms & S-curve. Able to analyze current progress situation and potential areas of concern, progress variance, productivity, forecast trend. Able to prepare daily, weekly, monthly reports. Experience and skill in overall project reporting (forecast, recovery plans, lookaheads & rolling schedules). Knowledge in float mapping using P6 in identification of Critical Path, and able to elaborate critical path, anticipate potential delays, establish recovery plans Able to establish realistic and robust planning to optimize the coordination, support claims and protect project interest against potential claim. Able to provide an as-built schedule and timely updated schedule situation depicting a comparison between the original baseline versus the actual execution. Able to integrate engineering, procurement, production and commissioning schedules into the overall project schedule. Leadership Requirements Can lead, direct and organize a team. Can do effective PowerPoint presentations. Able to chair meetings.

- Must possess at least a Vocational Diploma/Short Course Certificate. - Degree in Mechanical and Electrical is an advantage. - At least 1-2 years of experience with Revit MEP. - Preferably 1-4 years of experience specializing in MEP Engineering or equivalent. - Knowledge in MEP/HVAC system is an advantage. - Required skills: Revit, AECOsim. - Knowledge in the following software is an advantage: Dynamo, Naviswork Manage. - A good understanding/usage of written and verbal English is required. - Position level depends on years of experience. - Can do a Work from Home setup

Our Client is one of the biggest general contractors in Japan. It has a joint venture with another Japanese General Contractor to construct train stations and railways between Tutuban and Malolos. Responsibilities: Monitor the project status and provide assistance Study tender drawings and material specification Prepare quantity take-off and costing sheet for structural and architectural works Revise quantity and costing contracts Request and verify quotations from subcontractors and suppliers Ensure that the received quotations comply with the specifications Qualifications: With more than 20 years of experience in the construction industry With at least 10 years of experience as a Contract Manager With license in Civil Engineering With experience in handling civil related projects such as railways in local and abroad Well-versed in FIDIC Red Book Willing to work in Meycauayan, Bulacan Willing to work in a project-based employment Working Schedule: Monday to Saturday 7:30 am to 4:30 pm Salary range: 65,000-80,000 PHP per month gross

• Manages the over-all operation of the project • Prepares and monitors project budget • Prepares construction schedule and work methodology • Ensures that all construction works are executed in accordance with project specifications, budget, schedule and company policy. • Studies all project documents and prepares specific plans based on: a) Timing of materials delivery b) Timing of manpower complement c) Cash Flow • Conducts daily site inspections to ensure safety and quality of works Job Requirements:  Graduate of BS Civil Engineering, Registered Civil Engineer At least 8 years of relevant work experience in the same capacity Able to handle various projects such as industrial plants, buildings, factory construction and civilworks Knowledgeable in International Codes and Standards Reading comprehension of BID Documents Above average Communication Skills (oral & written) Leadership Skills Good Decision-making Skills  WIlling to work as 6 months contract <Better>Has working experience in japanese company

• Create the teams, develop the objectives/goals of each and assign individual responsibilities. • Project accounting functions including managing the budget, tracking of team expenses and minimizing exposure and risk in the project • Ensure that construction activities move according to pre-determined schedule. • Devise the project work plans and make revisions as and when need arises. • Coordinate the efforts of all parties involved in the project, which include the architects, consultants, contractors, sub-contractors and laborers. • Monitor the progress of the construction activities on a regular basis and hold regular status meetings with all the sub-teams. • Maintain strict adherence to the budgetary guidelines, quality and safety standards. • Regular inspection of construction sites. • Requisition of supplies/materials/ equipment to complete construction projects. • Ensure project documents and accomplishment/turn-over reports are complete for proper billing. • Identify the elements of project design and construction likely to give rise to disputes and claims. • Such other related work that the Management may ask from time to time. Qualifications Must be a graduate of Engineering Courses ( Civil, Electrical or Architecture) With background in CAD With experience in glass and aluminum industry set up or equivalent Willing to be assigned at Navotas City.

Location: Central Luzon, Northern Mindanao, Calabarzon & Mimaropa
Job Description: Job Summary: The Project Manager is responsible for the over-all management and direction of all activities leading to the safe, cost efficient and timely completion of a project while ensuring the quality of all works based on the approved contract. Detailed Job Description: In charge of the overall management of the project and all its activities. Designates the area of assignment of all operations personnel, taking into consideration their expertise and skill set to ensure quality, safe, timely, and cost efficient works execution. Ensures the quality of all project works execution. Leads the implementation of ESH and security policies in the entire project. Monitors the over-all accomplishment of the project and its actual costing. Leads in implementing control systems to manage the project cost and ensure the efficient expenditure of the project budget. Ensures that all project risks are mitigated upon identification. Maintains knowledge of the project contract terms and conditions to be taken into consideration in all actions and decisions concerning the project implementation. Ensures that all notification and substantiation of claims, and progress billings are regularly updated, monitored and submitted on time. Manages all project support groups to ensure the delivery of required support for the completion of the project. Holds regular project meetings to ensure all project team members are informed of the project status, discuss all project concerns and arrive at a resolution. Leads the project’s regular coordination meeting between the SCIC project team and its clients. Communicates with the project’s client or its representatives for all concerns involving the project. Reports all non-compliance to the project contract of the SCIC project team, sub-contractors or clients for to the Top Management for proper action. Ensures that the project KPI is timely accomplished and submitted. Reviews the performance of all project personnel. Enforces all existing company policies and ISO standards in the entire project. Maintains clear and open communication with the entire project team to keep everyone updated on organizational and department objectives and initiatives, to address various issues and relay other important information. Creates a project culture that inspires positive work outlook, work motivation and teamwork. Ensures that the corporate social responsibility of the project are accomplished. Performs other related job/duties as may be assigned by the management from time to time. Minimum Qualifications: Should be a graduate of civil engineering with active license. Must have atleast 15 years of construction experience. Must have atleast 5 years experience in project management. Should have strong leadership skills. Candidates should be amenable to work in new project sites located in Luzon / or Mindanao. Can start ASAP. 4 Full time positions available.

Job Title: CIVIL ENGINEER – CONSTRUCTION AND SITE OPERATIONS (URGENT- DAVAO CITY  BASED)
Job Description: What you need to succeed: Licensed civil engineer, with driver’s license (motor vehicle and/or motorcycle) Must have at least two (2) years of actual site experience in horizontal and/or vertical construction (those with experience especially in residential subdivision land development and residential and commercial building construction will be given top priority. Land development may encompass road preparation and concreting, drainage network construction, water supply systems, clearing and grading earthworks, construction of low-, medium-, and high-cost housing, etc.); Must be a highly organized and detail-oriented individual able to execute effective construction and project operations management at land development and building construction sites. Must be able to implement best practices in general construction and engineering operations; Must be already capable and qualified, or has the potential and willingness, to work in a supervisorial capacity at assigned actual project site. All sites are within Davao City. Must also be able to perform related planning and documentation functions. Periodic office/ tablework is required; Must be resourceful and be very familiar with the local (Davao City) building and construction industry; Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office applications; Must be effective in interacting with all project stakeholders (contractors, workers, regulatory bodies and inspectors, suppliers, property buyers/ owners, etc.) Responsibilities Will Include: The job entails the performance of civil engineering and site operations management functions for the planning and actual construction and site development of low-, mid-, and high-end residential subdivisions, as well as commercial buildings; Depending on the exact role and project assigned, the job may require construction quantitative accomplishment appraising, quality control and audit, project cost estimating, working plan analysis and review, workflow and equipment utilization planning, S-curve plotting, and/or selected property management functions and administrative support; The job is supervisorial and requires leadership ability. Compensation and Benefits: Initial salary range of 25,000-50,000, depending on actual experience upon hiring, with periodic salary increases depending on fit and performance; 14th month pay, mid-year bonuses, paid leaves, performance-based incentives and bonuses, medical insurance (Maxicare) upon regularization, and other benefits will be given. Interested persons may also apply in person for the position by submitting AN UPDATED, DETAILED AND COMPREHENSIVE RESUME at our Main Sales Office at Door 2 JJ’s Commune Loyola St., Bo. Obrero Davao City Inquiries and clarifications can be made via phone: 227-8372/ 228-2633/ 222-4433/ 0917-704-5066 (globe). Look for GEA or KAS. Note that only qualified applicants will be contacted for interview.

Project Onsite Engineer (Mandarin Language Required Completes engineering projects by organizing and controlling project elements. Develops project objectives by reviewing project proposals and plans and conferring with management. Determines project responsibilities by identifying project phases and elements, assigning personnel to phases and elements, and reviewing bids from contractors. Determines project specifications by studying product design, customer requirements, and performance standards. Completes technical studies and prepares cost estimates. Confirms product performance by designing and conducting tests. Determines project schedule by studying project plan and specifications, calculating time requirements, and sequencing project elements. Maintains project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, and resolving problems. Controls project plan by reviewing design, specifications, and plan, scheduling changes, and recommending actions. Controls project costs by approving expenditures and administering contractor contracts. Prepares project status reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends; recommending actions. Maintains safe and clean working environment by enforcing procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains project data base by writing computer programs; entering and backing up data. Maintains product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

General /Primary Purpose The position is responsible for leading, directing and coordinating cost estimations for construction projects, ensures that all data and estimations are accurate and is within the allocated project budget, provides recommendations and possible action plan to enhance and improve operations. Essential Functions Coordinates closely with the Project Manager, Operations Manager and H.R./Admin Manager in forecasting, estimation and planning of materials, supplies and manpower. Ensures that all estimations and costing are within the allocated budget of a particular construction projects. Coordinates with the Project Manager in defining project scopes, estimated project completion, phases to be estimated and schedule of phases or modules. Identifies and recognizes possible budget constraints and looks for possible ways on how to address problems that might affect the project operation and budget. Collects and gathers data to monitor and manage possible risks and identify contingency plans. Provides financial reporting, trending data and performs data analysis and development. Provides recommendations and action plans based on audit findings to enhance and improve operations and avoid delays in the completion of construction project. In-charge of auditing to ensure that financial reports and other reports are free from material mistreatment, whether caused by fraud or error. Conducts site inspection and coordinates with the QA/QC Engineer to ensure that the Labor Cost Estimated coincides with the project completion or accomplishment reports of both Admin Laborers and Sub-Con. Coordinates with the Accounting Staff to ensure accurateness and correctness of financial data to ensure that the construction project is within or outside its operational budget. Attends daily Safety Toolbox and observes strict adherence to safety protocols. Job Specifications/Qualifications The candidate must be/have: A Graduate of Mechanical, Industrial, Civil Engineering or any related Engineering Course; Knowledgeable in Risk Management, Cost Estimations or Engineering, Planning, Scheduling; Basic or Functional Knowledge in Accounting, Auditing and Finance; Computer Literate and familiarity with MS Office App, AutoCad, and other software and system related to engineering; Preferably with PRC License; At least 6 months to 1 year of experience in the same field.
