Create finished designs for a project, working primarily from the specifications and other inputs of lead designers. Revise drawings based on instructions from engineers or architects. Review engineering data to ensure compliance with the original design plans. Ensure designs meet required safety, civil and structural standards. Generate solid and surface CADD models using Autodesk Revit software. Develop presentations utilizing 3-dimensional using Autodesk 3D Max software. Complete designs and layouts for complete systems and components of a project. Perform layouts and designs of complex systems and equipment applicable to the respective discipline. Ensure compliance with required specifications, tolerances, safety factors and client requirements. Understand and apply commonly used company design standard and methods. Collaborate with civil and structural designers to ensure quality of design. Design and prepare As-built and revising mark-ups of civil and structural assemblies. Take responsibility for defined tasks within prescribed limits. Ensure quality and efficiency for assigned tasks and deliverables. Actively work on high-level tasks and deliverables for multiple projects simultaneously. Prepare for regular project team meetings pertaining to project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Requirements A Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering Ability to think critically, innovate, and solve challenging technical problems. In-depth knowledge of detailing civil and structural designs. Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Good written and verbal communication abilities, including preparing and giving presentations. More than 5 years of experience in CADD operating work for civil and structural design. Must be willing to work on-site.

With good english communication skills, oral and verbal. Willing to be assigned within and outside Metro Manila. This is for an Engineering/Construction Firm client based in Alabang, Muntinlupa. Responsibilities Manage civil design works, research applicable design criteria, attend project meetings, communicate with members of the project team, and report progress to the Design Coordinator. Coordinate all technical and administrative elements of each allocated design project to ensure all work is delivered in a professional, effective, and efficient manner while applying sound engineering principles. Manage investigations into various types of road and drainage engineering matters and prepare technical reports and cost estimates recommending appropriate actions to provide the most efficient and cost-effective solutions to at times complex problems. Prepare drawing packages for all stages of projects from initial concept, studies, and site plan approval through permitting, bidding, and construction. Understand local zoning ordinances' impacts on the development of site layouts. Develop cost-effective design layouts based on specifications and requirements. Analyze design issues and recommend corrective actions. Perform civil design analysis and calculations according to project requirements. Consider health, safety, and environmental requirement when developing civil designs. Ensure quality and efficiency for assigned tasks and deliverables. Actively work on high-level tasks and deliverables for multiple projects simultaneously. Prepare for regular project team meetings pertaining to project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Liaise with various professionals and departments to coordinate project details. Requirements A Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related fields. Demonstrate experience, knowledge, and skills in designing roads, utilities, and site development using Autodesk Civil 3D, BIM 360 Cloud, and other design software. Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Communication and project management skills. More than 5 years experience in design and construction projects. Must be willing to work on-site.

For CTM Management Corp. (A property management company, sister company of General Heat Corp., situated at the Makati Corporate Head Office.) Technical/Functional Skills: Facilities Management Assist immediate superior on overseeing of all building system including electrical system, air-conditioning and ventilation system, plumbing and sanitary system and all auxiliary system. Conduct regular inspection and monitoring on building equipment, machineries, panel boards as well as equipment room assigned by the Lead Technician. Recommends/implements improvements for preventive maintenance programs on an on-going basis and assist the facilities group on developing/maintaining effective building-specific maintenance and safety procedure manuals. Performs hands-on work in maintenance duties related to electrical, mechanical, plumbing and sanitary and auxiliary repairs and troubleshooting. Execute maintenance plan and procedures based on the 52-workweek schedule. Ensures the completion of maintenance checklists and repair records as required. Monitors all facilities equipment operating parameters. Monitors existing PMS third-party service provider works and contractors for special projects. Follows diagrams, operation manuals, manufacturers instruction and engineering standard in troubleshooting malfunctioning equipment. Performs related work as maybe assigned by the immediate superior. Implement good housekeeping program for all areas supervise to ensure compliance but not limited to 5S. Should be on-call 24/7 during emergency situation and willing to work overtime and on Sunday as necessary. Physical Requirements/Environmental Conditions Standing, Walking, Sitting, Reading, Stooping, climbing ladders, crawling in/through low spaces; Hand and Finger Dexterity, Clear Speech, Hearing/Listening Reading and Writing, Clerical, basic Math and Analytical Skills, Judgment, Problem Solving and Decision Making; and Ability to push or lift 50 pounds of equipment or machine. Other qualifications Licensed Registered Master Electrician and/or Register Master Plumber is preferred but not required. Graduate of two to four years in Vocational Training School. Minimum of two years’ experience in Building and Commercial Maintenance operation. Proven hands-on experience on maintenance operation and electro-mechanical equipment repair. An above average knowledge of electrical, plumbing, carpentry, and mechanical systems, with specialized knowledge in at least one of the before mentioned areas. Knowledgeable on using maintenance Tools and Equipment including but not limited to VOM, Clamp meter, Manifold gauge and the likes. Basic knowledge on Motor Control and/or PLC and machines/equipment (e.g. pumps and motor, AHU and genset). Basic understanding/knowledge on Philippine Electrical Code or National Building Code of the Philippines.

Role Objectives: To take on a key role within the sector/discipline, winning work, providing leadership, technical advice and leading by example, where appropriate. To manage selected projects, design teams and/or design processes (or parts of projects) to meet agreed budget, quality and timeframe targets. To deliver fully documented designs to meet client objectives and Arcadis system requirements. To develop the technical competency of direct reports and ensure application of international standards and engineering knowledge in various projects. To contribute towards the achievement of the sector/discipline business plan. Responsibilities The main responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: TECHNICAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Apply technical engineering techniques and methods using international design standards such as UK, US, and Middle East Water, Drainage and Fire Protection Design Codes. Prepare drawing markups and other design related documents. Oversee the project's detailed design and calculations. Supervise the design and drawing markup processes. Ensure design resources are working effectively and efficiently. Conduct internal review and quality checks of engineering drawings and design calculations to ensure compliance with the project's requirements. Liaise with other disciplines within the MEP Project Team for coordination MEP works and ensure all requirements are understood. Prepare and register all relevant documentation and design reports and ensure all documentation is accurate and in compliance with the Arcadis requirements. Liaise with the Function Leaders and Design Manager to keep informed of all developments or changes associated with the project. Ensure that the DE/AE/GEs supporting him/her are fully utilized. Identify risks and potential deviations to the project's required scope of work. Ensure compliance with scope of works, time schedule and cost control. Deliver technically complete design documentation, summary reports and technical reports for Design Managers. COMMERCIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Record man-hour charges accurately into weekly timesheets and ensure correctness of project and non-project man-hour charges. To be fully utilized. Always seek new work/tasks from Principal Engineer/Function Leader. PEOPLE MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES: Resource and develop skills and knowledge base of Design, Assistant and Graduate Engineers assigned to projects. Familiarize the CIBSE Training and Development Scheme and render mentoring duties to all Design, Assistant, and Graduate Engineers based on the CIBSE Competence Criteria. Liaise with BIM Manager and BIM Coordinators assigned to projects. Self time-management OTHERS: Working to achieve project delivery on time to budget and to a high standard in accordance with Client expectations. Take responsibility for defined tasks within prescribed limits. Gain experience and proficiency in Arcadis systems and procedures. Become familiar and compliant with Health and Safety regulations and guidelines. Perform other duties and responsibilities as required from time to time by your manager or Arcadis. QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Civil, Mechanical, or Sanitary Engineering from recognized University. Belong to the top 20% of the engineering class. Licensed Registered Civil, Mechanical, or Sanitary Engineer. 8 to 10 years minimum relevant post-graduate experience. Working towards Chartered Engineer status or equivalent license is an advantage but is not required. Excellent English written and verbal communication skills. Ability to provide solutions to technical problems. Excellent mathematical skills applied in engineering calculations. Ability to lead, with good influencing, motivating and delegating skills. Organizational skills and proactive approach in project management. Highly proficient in the application of international design standards: UK, US, and Middle East. Highly proficient in the following engineering design fundamentals: hot and cold water systems, sanitary plumbing, surface water drainage, gas systems, and fire protection system. Knowledgeable in AUTOCAD, REVIT and BIM environment. Highly proficient in using the following engineering software: ELITE, PIPEFLO, HYENA, REVIT and Microsoft Office. Actively continue to develop personally and technical knowledge and new emerging technology through regular CPD training. Key Competencies / Values: Client focus Excellence Trust Teamwork Responsibility Ethics

Job Title: Quality Assurance - Quality Control Construction Engineer
Job Description: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's or College degree in Mechanical Engineering Applicant must be computer literate Good in oral and written communication skills Experience in HVAC and Fire Protection System is an advantage At least one (1) year of working experience in the same position relevant to construction and a high rise building is an advantage Fresh graduate are also welcome to apply Full time position(s) available Can start ASAP

Key Accountabilities: • Take responsibility for your own safety and understand Arcadis Health and Safety Principles • Perform role in accordance with the Arcadis behavioral framework • Collaborate with other team members and other disciplines to deliver project requirements • Develop an understanding of the contribution that GEC teams make to the overall delivery of tasks and the projects within Arcadis • Work as a project resource, completing allocated activities to meet budget, timeframe and quality objectives and meeting or exceeding client expectations Apply analytical and planning skills as well as technical writing skills at a task level • Deliver work that meets Arcadis quality requirements • Operate as a competent professional within a single area of work with little supervision • Require direction from supervisor on new or unusual areas of work • Independently perform routine and some non-routine tasks • Contribute to the resolution of technical issues on projects • Liaise with Task Managers/Team Leaders to ensure effective communication on project matters • Undertake production checking of work in progress to ensure that it meets project intent • Follow training plan for professional development, attend appropriate training events • Commit to receiving on the job technical training by performing tasks, which are under the direct supervision of more experienced staff within well-defined limits • Work with a Mentor to develop technical excellence within a structured training program • Contribute to a range of professional planning assignments by undertaking practical tasks, monitoring and reviewing work undertaken by more junior colleagues and working with senior colleagues to ensure programs of work are undertaken and project milestones are met such as:, preparing and maintaining project programs; preparing Project Earned Value Management Systems; preparing schedule, resource, quantity progress, and performance reports and other reports as required; analyzing contractors’ schedules and compare them with Project Master Program; and notifying more senior colleagues of any discrepancies to ensure management has access to up-to-date and accurate information to aid their decision making • Understand and comply with all risk and compliance principles, taking standard corrective action or reporting any unsafe or inappropriate situations or wider project risks, to ensure the delivery of the project is not adversely impacted Interpret data and prepare supporting documentation such as schedules, feasibility studies and cost reports, making straightforward recommendations to support senior colleagues in their decision making process • Take proactive role in assessing and evaluating planning processes, sharing knowledge, identifying opportunities and providing advice to help improve processes and systems • Apply technical methods and expertise to complete complex, professional level tasks as requested by colleagues, prioritizing case load and interpreting established policies in order to effectively support the cost and commercial management function • Provide support on planning queries to customers inside and outside the business, ensuring an efficient and high-quality provision of information to all internal and external stakeholders • Assist senior staff to resolve stakeholder issues by flagging issues as soon as they are encountered and suggesting appropriate solutions in order to contribute to client care and ensure ongoing client satisfaction Knowledge & Experience: • Have developed deeper understanding of the services delivered by Arcadis and the industry sector • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills • Knowledge of Arcadis Management System requirements to support delivery of cost and commercial projects • Knowledge of Health and Safety regulations and guidelines • How to apply standard planning and program management practices, techniques and procedures • Excellent time management skills • Perform work in accordance with agreed-upon budget and schedule under supervision • Awareness of sustainable development best practice • Experience in delivering analysis and insights • Technical knowledge in specialized field, including construction processes and/or cost and planning • Advanced proficiency with desktop applications (e.g. MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and planning software (e.g. Primavera P6 and MS Project • Knowledge of own area of specialism and a developing understanding of wider organizational and program environment • Knowledge/Experience in visualization tools such as PowerBI/Tableau is a plus Key Qualifications: • BSc Engg, or equivalent in a relevant discipline • At least 2-4 years of professional experience in consultancy or contracting.

Job Description: Finance and Administrative Division One (1) Administrative Officer V (Supply Officer III) Basic Salary: P43,681.00 / month Item No.: PCHRDB-ADOF5-9-2004 Qualification Standard Education: Bachelor’s Degree relevant to the job Experience: 2 years of relevant experience Training: 8 hours of relevant training Eligibility: Career Service (Professional) Second Level Eligibility Preferred Qualifications/ Attributes · Preferably has a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Applied Science · Preferably with work experience in procurement, storage of supplies and equipment and proper disposal of unserviceable property in accordance with government prescribed standards; · Knowledgeable in 2016 Revised Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRR) of Republic Act 9184 otherwise known as Government Procurement Reform Act DBM and COA rules and regulations; · Knowledgeable in Microsoft applications e.g Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access; · Must have good oral and written communication skills; · With good interpersonal skills, positive work attitudes and good moral character; · Has initiative and is forward-thinking Duties and Responsibilities 1. Oversee and direct all activities of the Council , pertaining to general services and supply and property management; 2. Responsible for coaching, mentoring, resolving issues, providing feedback and serving as a link between subordinates and upper management; 3. Setting goals for key performance indicators and deadlines in ways that will directly contribute to the Councils mandate, plans and vision and communicate them to subordinates; 4. Organize the smooth workflow and ensure that employees understand their duties and or delegated tasks; 5. Investigates complaints and non-compliance to policies and procedures, and provide corrective action/s; 6. Integrate continual improvement on all aspect of product and services; and 7. Ensure adherence to legal and regulatory policies and procedures and undertake disciplinary actions if the need arises; Supply and Property Management: 8. Create and maintain a monitoring system of internal control procedures to safeguard the Council assets against theft and pilferage; 9. Regularly review stock inventory re-order point to ensure continuous availability of common use supplies and materials; 10. Conduct periodic physical counts of Office Supplies Inventory and Property, plant and Equipment; 11. Maintain up to date records of Property Accountabilities and Inventory and Inspection Report for Unserviceable Property (IIRUP) and recommend to management whether PPE should be disposed of; General Services Management: 12. Plans, designs and prepares estimates and specifications for general construction and maintenance works and other related systems and equipment; 13. Inspects building facilities, vehicle, equipment and machineries periodically to determine problems and necessary maintenance; 14. Prepares preventive maintenance schedules for building, vehicle, equipment and machineries; 15. Supervises outsource maintenance contractor’s in the installations, renovations, repairs or maintenance of facilities, equipment and machineries (technician, plumbers, carpenter, etc.); 16. Inspects the work of outsource maintenance contractors for adherence to codes, plans and specifications; 17. Provides inputs in coordination with other division in the development of plans, designs and specifications of infrastructure and other related projects (e.g. renovations); 18. Ensures that all works adhere to quality standards and health and safety regulations; 19. Continually improve systems, procedures and processes to ensure more efficient services and operations; and 20. Performs other duties that maybe assigned from time to time. JOB SUMMARY Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the project detailed planning, preparation, implementation and completion of various work stages related to the construction of the assigned project. He is responsible in monitoring and reporting to the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager on the project accomplishment. He directs the external Construction Manager on the daily activities to ensure attainment of project objectives. This will include but not limited to the following: Assists Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the conduct of review and documentation of revisions of Plans, Designs and Specifications from Design Development (DD) up to For Construction Drawings (FCD). Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the value engineering process by establishing cost saving items performance tracking & monitoring system to ensure attainment of project cost savings. Assists Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in communicating and monitoring compliance on the mitigating actions of the Risk Management Plan. Look for continuous improvement opportunity for the established Risk Management Plan. Assist the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in monitoring that all applicable permits, clearances and certifications during the project construction and post-construction stages are properly secured, maintained and turned-over to BTG and GPMC upon project completion. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the conduct of the pre-bid meetings, clarificatory meetings, bid submissions & opening of Project Work Bid Packages including bid tabulation of Project's Work Packages of the assigned project. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the preparation and preliminary review of the Contract Agreements, Letter of Awards (LOA) and Notice to Proceed (NTP) by providing adequate and accurate annexes and/or attachments. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the consolidation of information such as attachment and annexes for the submission of the Weekly and Monthly Reports including periodic Percent of Completion (POC) Certification as required for Accounting Reports. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the conduct of Weekly and Monthly PM Meetings including the required project site walk-through site inspections. The PO/APM shall be responsible in documenting the minutes of the Weekly and Monthly PM Meetings and the monitoring of closure of issues identified during the walk-through site inspection. Assist the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the conduct of the emergency meetings with concerned members of the Project Team, Contractors and Suppliers. The Project Management Assistant Manager shall be responsible in documenting the minutes of the emergency meeting. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the preparation of the long and short list of Bidders / Suppliers for project use. Monitor performances of Bidders / Suppliers and give feedback to Project Management Manager. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the preparation of required attachment & annexes of the Project Authorization Orders (PAO), Billing / Payment Certificates, Request for Check Payments (RCP), Work Authorization Orders (WAO) and Change Order Requests (COR). Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in communicating and monitoring of compliances of the project site to the provisions and requirements of the Planning & Engineering - Systems & Procedures. Responsible in ensuring the proper implementation of the management systems set by the Planning & Engineering - Systems & Procedures. Provide assistance to the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the implementation and monitoring of the health and safety objectives, targets and programs, promotion of the accident-free workplace and compliance monitoring to applicable statutory and legal laws and requirements. Provide assistance to the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the implementation and monitoring of the environmental protection objectives, targets and programs, promotion of the environment-friendly workplace and compliance monitoring to applicable statutory and legal laws and requirements. Provide assistance to the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in ensuring and monitoring that QA/QC inspection on workmanship is performed on completed project works at each phases of the project including closures of rectification issues/works prior to turn-over and acceptance of the units by BTG. Assists Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in preparing SAP-PR and its required documentation and attachments. Check adequacy of attachments for billing purposes in compliance to the SAP billing procedures. Provide recommendation approval of Contractor(s) payment. Provide actions on turn-over (to QAD) & CRM issues raised by the SAP/CRM coordinators. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in the implementation and completion monitoring of the punch list items (w/in Construction Warranty) and the timely turn-over of condo units to QAD/Engg-QA/QC (or to Property Management for turn-over of amenities, common areas and commercial areas). Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in monitoring the project management activities that will lead to the attainment of the established project KRAs under his/her assigned project. Assists the Project Management Manager/Project Management Senior Project Manager in collating and tabulating accomplished VPER forms of the Contractors & Suppliers involved in the assigned project. The PO will be responsible in forwarding the accomplished VPER forms to the Process Improvement and Control Sr. Manager. Performs other duties that may be assigned from time to time. Educational Requirements Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Post Graduate Diploma / Master's Degree, Architecture, Engineering (Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Sanitary) or equivalent. possessing a valid PRC licensed or its equivalent Experience Requirements At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Assistant Manager / Managers specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. With at least 3+ years of project management experience, including tracking and planning projects Skills Strong leadership, diplomatic and motivational skills Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation and excellence Good leadership, communication (written, verbal and presentation) and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, decisive, with the ability to adapt to change and competing demands Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint With experience in leading projects and programs to on-time, on-schedule and within budget close Flexible with proven ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities Must be able to learn, understand and apply new technologies Proven ability to demonstrate a drive for results and accountability of business needs Work Location Metro Manila (Pasay, Pasig, Paranaque) Sta. Rosa, Laguna Calamba, Laguna Tagaytay City Dasmarinas Cavite Cainta, Rizal Cagayan De Oro Cebu Bacolod Iloilo

Job Specification: 1. To Ascertain that all materials incorporated into work pass the requirement of DPWH Standard Specifications for Highways, Bridges and Airport and to strictly comply with the schedule of Minimum Testing Requirements. 2. To prepare design mixes for concrete and bitumen mixtures. 3. To conduct soil investigations and materials survey of probable sources of materials, and reporting approximate quantity available, suitability of materials and other pertinent data. 4. To see that samples are sent to the Regional/District Laboratory are well packed in durable containers to avoid damages at transit, and that all samples are accompanied by a card filled-up in detail. 5. To see that all weighing devices and testing machines are maintained and calibrated in accordance with the DPWH Standard Specification. 6. To have at all times the complete and up-to-date materials map of the province or city, charts and diagrams showing progress of work, etc. posted in laboratory building. 7. To submit within required time frame tests reports and other pertinent papers to the Project Implementing Office. 8. To develop a system filling pertinent reports on testing quality control ready at any time for appraisal, inspection or quality assurance audit. Qualifications: 1. Must be a Civil Engineer. 2. With at least 3 years work experience in the same capacity or equivalent or much willing to learn. 3. Must be an accredited Materials Engineer. 4. Strong sense of professionalism and integrity. 5. Must be keen in details, patient and optimistic. 6. Possesses good judgement and decision making skill. 7. Possesses good communication and leadership skills.

Analyze control or survey data to ensure adherence to project specifications or land survey standards. Calculate the exact horizontal and vertical position of points on the earth's surface. Verify the mathematical correctness of newly collected survey data. Plan or direct the work of geodetic surveying staff, providing technical consultation as needed. Assess the quality of control data to determine the need for additional survey data for engineering, construction, or other projects. Maintain databases of geodetic and related information including coordinate, descriptive, or quality assurance data. Conduct surveys to determine exact positions, measurement of points, elevations, lines, areas, volumes, contours, or other features of land surfaces. Compute horizontal and vertical coordinates of control networks, using direct leveling or other geodetic survey techniques such as triangulation, trilateration, and traversing to establish features of the earth's surface. Request additional survey data when field collection errors occur or engineering surveying specifications are not maintained. .Read current literature, talk with colleagues, continue education, or participate in professional organizations or conferences to keep abreast of developments in technology, equipment, or systems. Compute, retrace, or adjust existing surveys of features such as highway alignments, property boundaries, utilities, control and other surveys to match the ground elevation-dependent grids, geodetic grids, or property boundaries and to ensure accuracy and continuity of data used in engineering, surveying, or construction projects. Prepare progress or technical reports. Determine orientation of tracts of land, including position, boundaries, size, and shape, using theodolites, electronic distance-measuring equipment, satellite-based positioning equipment, land information systems, or other geodetic survey equipment. Distribute compiled geodetic data to government agencies or the general public. Review existing standards, controls, or equipment used, recommending changes or upgrades as needed. Provide training and interpretation in the use of methods or procedures for observing and checking controls for geodetic and plane coordinates.

Developing, modifying, testing and evaluating materials Providing technical advice about the suitability of materials Diagnosing faults Advising on, planning and organising inspections, maintenance and repairs Overseeing operational quality control processes Liaising with suppliers, customers and manufacturing/development staff Supervising engineering and technical staff Undertaking relevant research

Job Responsibilities: The position is primarily responsible for managing all costs related to construction and building projects. Monitor and validate billings from contractors. Service Manager Job Description We are looking for a detail-oriented Service Manager to manage our service department and handle customer service interactions, reports, and repairs. The Service Manager's responsibilities include providing the highest level of customer service, developing lasting customer relationships, and managing the service team members. The Service Manager maintains a strong working knowledge of all industry standards and practices as well as the company's products and services. To be successful as a Service Manager, you should display a strong sales-minded attitude as well as excellent leadership skills. You should also have the ability to develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with customers and third-party vendors. Service Manager Responsibilities: -Evaluate mechanical problems in vehicles using diagnostic equipment. -Help mechanics evaluate mechanical problems and inspect repairs completed. -Rebuild, replace or repair major trucks and heavy equipment components, assemblies and systems including engines, transmissions etc. -Perform routine vehicle maintenance and preventive care. -Help and train mechanics and helpers. -Delegating and directing service tasks, monitoring the progress of current projects, and managing service team members to ensure the team's objectives and sales goals are met. -Handling customer complaints or concerns quickly and professionally to maintain good customer relationships and ensure repeat customers. -Assisting with or performing administrative tasks, such as managing and updating invoices, processing new orders, and tracking inventory. -Setting up and maintaining a service desk and evaluating its efficiency. -Resolving service desk problems and improving service methods to increase the service desk's productivity and customer service. ·Monitoring department issues and client complaints to create methods to lessen recurring issues. -Auditing work and customer service to ensure the company's high standards, efficiency, and productivity goals are met. -Maintaining strong relationships with clients, management, and Sales Representatives. -Helping to train new employees in company procedures. -Maintaining a strong working knowledge of industry regulations, restrictions, and laws, ensuring the company's adherence to these regulations, and remaining current on the industry's standards and new innovations, materials, tools, and processes. Service Manager Requirements: -A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. -Advance knowledge of diesel and fuel engine maintenance and repair -Ability to diagnose mechanical problems and perform repairs independently. -Ability to operate equipment and tools involved in vehicle repair. -Strong background in mechanical works most especially trucks and heavy equipment. -Previous after sales and management experience may be advantageous. -Strong industry knowledge. -Strong values of Integrity, Fairness, Accountability and a role model. -Excellent leadership, communication, sales, and customer service skills. -Computer literacy and good organizational skills. -Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills. -The ability to work under pressure and handle stress.

About us Tungsten Structures are the best small firm in Australia and also the Australian building industry’s number one for value adding structural engineering, as recognised and awarded in 2020 by Consult Australia. Our focus is to always embrace our creative mindsets to achieve our greatest potential. By doing this we not only save our clients maximum construction dollars through contemporary, investigative and economical designs but we also produce highly innovative, engaging, and interactive documentation. We provide a more unique service offering to that of the robotic and generic one size fits all solution currently offered in the marketplace. We are fresh, our solutions are always considered, and we are fun to do business with. Tungsten Structures work together with our clients within loyal and exclusive relationships, to provide significant value to the lives and projects of all stakeholders involved. We are nationally recognised industry experts, specifically, for providing efficient and data rich industrial and retail sector structural engineering designs. About the role An exciting new opportunity is now available in our Manila office for a full-time (Monday-Friday 8am-4.30pm) experienced Senior Structural Steel Detailer with advanced skills in Tekla Structures. As we continue to expand on our fresh steel detailing service, the Senior Structural Steel Detailer will be influential in delivering exceptionally high quality steel detailing documentation to our clients. There is also a future growth opportunity to lead and contribute to the growth of our team of structural steel detailers and add valuable input into the continual improvement of our systems and processes. The Senior Structural Steel Detailer will work closely with the Associate Tekla Manager in Brisbane, and report directly to our Philippine Tekla Manager who is working for Tungsten Structures from a private office in Bacoor City, Manila. This role presents an opportunity for a motivated and driven individual to take the next step in the steel detailing journey. Key activities include (but not limited to) Responsibility for checking 3D Tekla model from Engineering sketches and Architectural drawings. Resolve building geometry challenges by coordinating with Engineering and Architectural teams. Detail connections in Tekla in line to the Australian standards. Resolve connection challenges by coordinating with engineers. Responsible for marking plan and shop drawing presentation. Involved in coordinating a detailing team to meet detailing schedules. Provide input in the continual development of steel detailing systems and processes. Experience required 10+ years’ experience with Australian projects, ideally industrial sector. 10+ years’ experience using Tekla Structures, experience with version 2019 or newer. Experience of Australia standards to implement in detailing. Strong understanding of Australian market proprietary products such as purlins and girts, handrailing. Experience with project management and leading small detailing teams. Your Capabilities Excellent written, verbal and listening skills in the English language. Be confident and efficient working with both autonomously and in a team environment. Goal orientated, the ability to work to deadlines and be flexible to adapt to changing client deadlines. High attention to detail. Identify and communicate problems and opportunities immediately. Actively participates in own learning and development. How to apply If this describes you then please apply now with BOTH your cover letter and resume/CV via the link. Please ENSURE you address the following questions in your cover letter otherwise your application will not be considered. Where do you currently live and how will you travel to Bacoor City everyday? Do you have immediate family in Manila, if so who are they? (ie wife, husband, children etc) What are your personal interests? Which Australian companies have you worked for? Which Australian projects have you worked on? What are your base salary expectations in PHP per month? Please attach recent examples from your portfolio to showcase to us your best work!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: The Reservoir Engineering Specialist is responsible for the interpretation of the physics of the reservoir and optimization of well and reservoir performance, which are used in management decision-making that are critical to and entails company investments, costs and revenues. The responsibility of the Reservoir Engineering Specialist include the following, to ensure compliance with the organization mandate and customer requirements: Resource assessment and reserve estimation to determine the energy potential of a geothermal resource in all phases of geothermal energy assessment and exploitation in all local and international fields of interest to the company; Conduct of accurate well and reservoir evaluation and interpretation through industry standard methods such as modeling and well test analysis to determine well behavior and performance; Formulation of detailed, cost effective, and appropriate technical solutions to optimize well and reservoir performance through the conduct of special research studies and application of appropriate methods; Leading the design of special well testing programs to measure specific well and reservoir properties; Review of reservoir analytical and numerical models; Preparation of plans for endorsement to RME head the and management of the utilization of the resources allocated to each facility related work program, and when applicable, develops strategies to manage resource limitation. Participation in high-level meetings to monitor the progress of programs and discuss current technical issues and concerns related to reservoir management and operations of geothermal facilities; and Conduct of Reservoir Engineering training to upgrade skills of staff, and hence improve performance and productivity. JOB RESPONSIBILITES Responsible for the upkeep and preventive maintenance on all facility mechanical, electrical and other installed system to ensure safety standards. Responsible for the supervision of all maintenance and other technical support staff to ensure efficiency in the operation.Perform facility and equipment inspections and report on conditions affecting operations, determine the need for repairs or renovations and recommend actions to be taken.Respond to emergencies 24/7.Prepare and ensure proper implementation of preventive maintenance of all major and minor equipment of the building. Conducts inspection of all on-going construction/renovation works and ensure compliance with the Condo Corp’s Deed of Restrictions for Renovations proposed by unit owner. Review utilities consumptions and strive to minimum costs. Supervise works of all external contractors.Comply with all safety procedures and requirements. Support any afterhours building needs and activities as required.Attend and conduct training sessions and seminars such as mantrap; Generates utilities consumption reports for processing of billings. Prepares the budget for repair and maintenance. Prepares weekly report regarding status of all facility and equipment. Ensures compliance with all government requirements of the building.Develop strong relationship with key personnel. Assist the Property Manager to ensure all equipment and facilities are in good condition. Do other task necessary for technical aspect of the building. Performs other duties as may be assigned by the immediate superior MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Education : Licensed Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineer Experience : At least three (3) years of experience in the same fieldPreferably with at least three (3) experience in property management setup/building maintenance operationsOther Skills : Knowledgeable in repair and maintenance including but not limited to mechanical and electrical troubleshooting, and repair of property equipment and facilities

The Project Manager oversees all aspects of the planning, execution, monitoring and control of the overall operations of his assigned project. He/She is responsible in managing all contract negotiations, and successfully complete the project with the goal of meeting schedule, meeting quality standards, and staying within proposed gross margin projections while maintaining good customer and vendor relationships. Job Description: Provides managerial and technical supervision of the overall planning, execution, monitoring and control of the project activities. Directs the review and implementation of budgets, detailed schedules, work plans and manpower projections. Handles the organizing, staffing and updating of the project table of organization in coordination with HR. Ensures compliance with Company Policies/Procedure, Employee Code of Ethics and Conduct, and Corporate Governance. Job Specification: Must be a Licensed Civil or Electrical Engineer Preferably with formal training in Project Management Knowledgeable in PMBoK (Project Management Body of Knowledge) At least seven (7) years of relevant electrical experience in various structures such as buildings, infrastructure, industrial, power plants, especially in Transmission lines and Substations Willing to be assigned to any projects nationwide.

Responsible in coordinating with supervision / subcon about site completion status Responsible in preparing documents for Civil Works Acceptance activities. Responsible in following up the PAT progress for civil works, summarize the status, find problems, and solve problems Responsible in pushing sub-con and internal team to provide supporting documents. Responsible in preparing various reports needed by the project Responsible in escalating the issues to management. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Must have bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering Must have basic knowledge of Civil works, Telecom Tower, Structure, Telecom architecture. Must be confident, knowledgeable of basic construction process, schedule analysis, and problem-solving skills Proficient in documentation, document processing and MS Office Applications (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, etc.). Well-organized and must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills Flexible to work long hours as demanded by the project Open and willing to learn new knowledge. Davao City resident and willing to travel in Mindanao.

Purpose of the position The primary role of the Highway Engineer is to support the roads and highway engineering services for the SMEC Philippines Office under the direction of the Deputy Transport Manager/Project Manager. Key Responsibilities: Assist the Senior Highway Engineer in the roads and highway design activities for the project, including all quality control and checking of designs. Provide professional and competent engineering design for roads and highway. The services would include field work (limited), analysis, design and reporting. Analysis and design of all roads and highway projects. Ensure all designs are prepared in accordance with the Design Process Plan and standards as issued by SMEC. Be able to liaise with Client and other stakeholders independently during the design process and ensure client requirements are clearly identified and addressed. Liaise with other disciplines involved in the Project such as the architectural, mechanical, electrical, civil and rail teams to ensure all structures are fit for purpose, code compliant and meet the Client’s requirements. Provide clear and concise reports related to the design, and in accordance with the Client requirements. Review and check CADD and drafting outputs in relation to roads and highway design. Job Summary: The Planner is responsible for the preparation of the tender requirements related to scheduling, the master program and the project progress reports to ensure efficient scheduling and timely implementation of the project. Duties and Responsibilities: Prepare the proposed construction schedule and calculate resource assignments, including manpower loading and tools and equipment utilization, to provide an efficient project implementation plan and support the cost proposal to the Client. Review the completeness of the technical proposal to verify proper and complete compilation of the requirements by the Client. Review all the contract documents and consider all the deliverables and project execution plan to support appropriateness and reasonableness of the master program. Prepare the master program and calculate resource assignments, including manpower loading and tools and equipment utilization, to provide the most efficient schedule and allow the orderly performance and timely completion of the project. Prepare the material procurement schedule, in coordination with the Procurement Team, to provide guidance on the proper timing of each step of the procurement process. Update the master program, the manpower loading and the material procurement schedule to reflect the actual progress, the scope changes, and the revisions needed to provide an efficient and effective schedule that will facilitate the timely completion of the project. Conduct field scoping to clarify or confirm progress and scope changes. Coordinate with the Customer, Operations team, concerned Department Heads, and other trade contractors for the efficient resolution of concerns and for the proper execution of the project. Assist in the supervision of the Planner II and III in their daily transactions to ensure proper performance of their technical functions. Maintain a systematic and well-organized filing system for documentations related to planning and scheduling to ensure completeness of records and to provide easy access to reference. Assist in the creation and implementation of department policies, procedures and forms for the efficient and effective performance of department processes and to ensure controls are in place. Provide back-up relief for other team members and perform ad-hoc tasks that may be assigned from time to time to provide support to the department and the Company. Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree, Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. Required language(s): English At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): Primavera, MS Project, MS Office Preferably 5 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent.

Reviews and monitors all the equipment, machines and tools used in the project. Prepares and submits necessary reports and documents required by the Management and Client. The Purpose of the position The Construction Manager will manage and oversee the project and coordinate a project from start to finish, including organising the schedule of work, costings and budget. plan the work and oversee the necessary materials and equipment. hire and manage staff for the project. and will include the following responsibilities: Manage Consultants supervision Team to oversee the construction site, main contractor, and workers to ensure project works are delivered to a high level of quality and safety according to the stipulated requirements by the Employer. Overall responsible for the effective implementation and successful completion of construction project within schedule, cost and quality. Report to Employer’s senior management on project progress, conduct monthly, weekly and ad-hoc meetings with the Employer to discuss on strategies to complete the construction works efficiently and effectively. Conduct monthly, weekly, and ad-hoc meetings with Employer and Contractor to track project progress and provide necessary expert advice to complete works effectively. Liaise closely with the entire Consultant Supervision Team which include Construction Supervision Team (Senior Engineers, Section Engineers, Engineers and inspectors for project management delivery), Design Team, Project Management Support Team, Contract Advisory Team to provide excellent and timely services to the Client to manage Construction Supervision works and lead the team to achieve project goals and objectives. Manage each phase of the project from design to completion and ensure efficient use of resources and enhance cost-effectiveness. Guarantees that all work is performed in accordance with approved methodologies and procedures. Ensures that the project is constructed and documented in accordance with the contract documents and good engineering practices. Develop and maintain project cost/change controls, and project budget and accounting records. Monitor and manage works to ensure Contractor carryout works in accordance with the Project Schedule. Performs change order estimating and assists the Construction Manager/Project Manager in-change for negotiations. Assists in managing and reviewing the progress of contractors’ construction schedules. Reviews weekly and monthly reports on the status and progress of the contracts, including project costs and potential changes. Undertake any other work duties as required by the project Key Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil/Structural Engineering, preferably registered Civil Engineer. With 20 years’ experience in managing large scale civil engineering construction projects, of which 10 years were spent mainly on marine works that involved significant dredging, reclamation and rock works as well as wharf and jetty construction. Experience in risk assessment, geotechnical and engineering works, environmental impact assessments, tender documents, site supervision and contract administration. Other pre-requisites are excellent team spirit, strong technical competence, good interpersonal skills and with a “can-do” attitude. Willing to accept Project-based status. Willing to be assigned in Bulacan, Bulacan. Be part of something GREAT. Be part of SMEC Philippines, Inc.

Job Title: Senior Construction Project Engineer - Civil Engineer (Laguna Site)
Job Description: Job Summary: The Senior Construction Project Engineer – Civil Engineer is to complete engineering and construction projects by planning, organizing and controlling all elements of the project. He will supervise all development and implementation of a project and will be actively involved in any other project site -related work. He will be responsible for establishing project inspection criteria, coordinating the review of project designs and ensuring the proper implementation of project elements. Duties and Responsibilities: Plan projects and establish the criteria by which project success will be measured. Reviews project plans and proposals, then works with management to develop project objectives. Identifies project responsibilities by determining the phases and elements of the project. Calculates time frames and sequences the stages of the project. Prepares and distributes a description and timeline of the project. Presents cost estimates and performance standards. Conducts tests assuring safe and satisfactory product performance. Prepares status reports and regularly monitors budgets, contractors and schedules. Allocates project resources appropriately; approves expenditures; employee contractor contracts. Keeps an accurate record and electronic data base of all elements of the projects. Presents procedures, rules and regulations to those involved in the project; maintains a safe, clean and productive environment through enforcing procedures. Maintains project integrity and reputation through compliance with local regulations. Demonstrate knowledge in civil engineering principles, practices and methods, environmental regulations, engineering project management methods, workplace safety, budgeting, employee supervision and personnel management. Collaborate with the Senior Engineers to create more efficient methods and maintain profitability. Create the framework used to develop and monitor project metrics and manage the collection of project data. Required Education, Skills, and Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering Licensed CE is a must Project site management experience is a must Excellent project management skills desired Must have strong written and verbal communication skills Willing to be assigned in Laguna

JOB DESCRIPTION: Determines project responsibilities by identifying project phases and elements; assigning personnel to phases and elements; reviewing bids from contractors. Determines project specifications by studying product design, customer requirements, and performance standards; completing technical studies; preparing cost estimates. Confirms product performance by designing and conducting tests. Determines project schedule by studying project plan and specifications; calculating time requirements; sequencing project elements. Maintains project schedule by monitoring project progress; coordinating activities; resolving problems. Controls project plan by reviewing design, specifications, and plan and schedule changes; recommending actions. Controls project costs by approving expenditures; administering contractor contracts. Prepares project status reports by collecting analyzing, and summarizing information and trends; recommending actions. Maintains safe and clean working environment by enforcing procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains project data base by writing computer programs; entering and backing up data. Maintains product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. JOB SUMMARY A Quantity Surveyor handles the process of bidding and awarding of the projects in assigned areas. Duties include preparing of bid documents, detailed estimate and cost breakdown, evaluating and endorsing tenders. He/she is responsible for monitoring OTC of assigned projects to ensure projects are awarded on time. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILIES 1.) SCOUTING OF RELIABLE CONTRACTORS Scout qualified contractors for various housing, MRBs, Open Space & Land Development Project 2.) BIDDING OF ASSINGED PROJECTS Issues “Invitation to Bid” to qualified contractors Prepares and reviews Bid Documents to determine complete project's parameter/scope of works Attends pre-bidding conferences Prepares detailed cost estimates in conformance with standard plans and specifications to come out with competitive project cost Evaluates proposal prior to issuance of clarifications to ensure the completeness to contractor's bid Endorse tender evaluation and recommendation for management proposal 3.) AWARDING OF ASSIGNED PROJECTS Award assigned projects within the approved TPRC budget Uploads project milestone in SAP to create PO for project monitoring and billing purposes Uploads project milestones in HCOM for housing projects 4.) EVALUATING CHANGE ORDERS, REPAIR WORKS AND BUDGETARY COST ESTIMATES Evaluates change orders to validates/check the discrepancies between bid and construction plans Evaluates repair works and budgetary cost estimates based on current market price 5.) OTC AND PROJECT MONITORING Attain calendar of Bids &Awards of assigned projects to ensure timely start of construction from the issuance of OTC QAULIFICATIONS Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent; Preferably licensed. Required language(s): English, Filipino At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.

Job Title: Senior Structural Technician (Bridges, Maritime and Structures)
Job Description: WSP, a world leading management and consultancy firm, is seeking Senior Structural Technician (Bridges, Maritime and Structures) to join their Transport Structures Team. The fast-paced firm is rapidly expanding, and this is a great opportunity to join a dynamic team of Bridge design and drafting experts who will support your growth and development. Your responsibilities: —Responsible for the accuracy of all structural drafting tasks. —Ensures all drawings are checked before they are issued to the client. —Ensures all drawings comply with CAD Standards and Quality Systems relevant to specialisation and location —Undertake reviews of engineering drawings to ensure compliance with CAD Standards and Quality Systems. —Carries out audits of drawings-in-progress, as well as the final drawings. —Responsible in the development of drawings from designer sketches and working sheets to the final outputs taking into consideration the clarity, completeness and accuracy of the plan. —Accountable for the coordination and production of drawings and drafting requirements of the assigned project/s. —Mentors staff on drafting procedures and approaches to performing tasks. —Responsible for maintaining back-up of drawing files –hard and soft copies for record and future references. —Carry out cross discipline reviews, constructability checks and clash detection reviews —Evaluates staff performance in linewith HR procedures. —Conscientiously works towards the group’s objectives and adheres to the company’s policy. —Perform tasks assigned by the Drafting Discipline Lead/ BAS Discipline Lead / Transport Manila Operations Manager/ Regional Team Executive in line withhis experience, discipline or qualifications. Your Qualifications: —Diploma of Engineering or Advanced Diploma of EngineeringequivalenttoSenior Technical Associate –CADDorGraduate of any technical course or at least three (3) years in BS Engineering or BS Architecture course. —At least seven (7) years of relevant structural drafting experience —High level drafting and detailing skills —High level use and understanding of CAD software and how it applies (AutoCAD, MicroStation, ProjectWise, Revit) —Prepares engineering drawing deliverables from sketches, calculations and/or specifications —Experience in a senior team role —Exposure to different business models and industry best practice —Preferably with experience on Australian projects At WSP, being curious about the future inspires us to innovate and deliver impactful and sustainable designs today. Be part of our team doing purposeful work, helping our communities thrive today, while shaping them for tomorrow. To express your interest please click on the 'Apply Now' button.

Company: PERI PSS GmbH-PHILIPPINE REGIONAL OPERATING HEADQUARTER
Job Description: Main Task: Responsible to develop the most cost-effective formwork, shoring or scaffolding solutions for various kinds of concrete construction projects. These solutions are based on PERI’s standard product systems that range from straight wall formwork for retaining walls to more sophisticated systems used in the construction of the highest buildings in the world. Duties & Responsibilities: Develop efficient formwork solutions for clients (including drawings, BOQs and calculations) and evaluate the project based on technical and financial requirements, specification and risk. Prepare formwork and shoring drawings for various concrete structures using AutoCAD and other PERI specific software. Improve his/her knowledge in all PERI standard products. Develop design knowledge for more sophisticated PERI systems (e.g. PERI UP) according to assignment by the management. Perform static analysis and checks to ensure the optimal design. Assure that he/she works using all his drafting skills on the highest possible level. Collect actively required information and ensure the information flow with his/her colleagues and superiors. Work closely with the technical team of PERI subsidiaries regarding the best design where the formwork equipment is to be utilized most. Professional Requirements: Must possess at least a Bachelor’s degree & Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Civil Engineering. At least 1 year up to 3 years of working experience in PERI design engineering for formworks, shoring/scaffolding industry or a minimum of 3-5 years of non-PERI formwork experience for new employees. With excellent AutoCAD & MS Office skills. Certificate in AutoCAD training or equivalent is preferred. With general knowledge of local laws and regulations; basic experience in site service and costing and man hour estimation of projects. Fresh graduates who are willing to be trained and exposed in formwork and scaffolding industry are also welcome to apply. Personal Attributes: Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain good working relationships at all levels Patience Drives Continuous Improvement Excellent communication skills Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Calm and able to respond to difficult situations with sensitivity Strong and proven analytical skills Able to work accurately with good attention to detail Ability to adapt to change

This is for an Engineering/Construction Firm client based in Alabang, Muntinlupa. Job Responsibilities: Manage structural design works, research applicable design criteria, attend project meetings, communicate with members of the project team, and report progress to the Design Coordinator. Coordinate all technical and administrative elements of each allocated design project to ensure all work is delivered in a professional, effective, and efficient manner while applying sound engineering principles. Deliver innovative, sustainable, efficient, safe, practical, and intelligent structural engineering solutions on all projects and other activities, appropriate to the stage and type of project. Perform design and analysis functions for various structures. Conduct assessments and evaluations of existing structures. Develop solutions to challenges within budget, schedule, and project constraints. Ensure the overall stability of designs in the permanent/final condition as well as during construction. Ensure health and safety are considered at all stages of the design process such that the designs produced minimize risk during construction while exceeding the client’s expectations. Prepare drawing packages for all stages of projects from Basis of Design, Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents, and Contract Administration. Ensure quality and efficiency for assigned tasks and deliverables. Actively work on high-level tasks and deliverables for multiple projects simultaneously. Prepare for regular project team meetings pertaining to project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Review shop drawings and samples to ensure drawings and finishes match specifications. Revisit designs and make adjustments to designs as needed. Liaise with various professionals and departments to coordinate project details. Qualifications: A Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering Must have a current license to practice from the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC). Accredited and a member of their respective profession’s organization. Well-versed in international and local codes, standards, and regulations. Decisive with excellent critical thinking skills. Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Good written and verbal communication abilities, including preparing and giving presentations. Proficient in STAAD, Autodesk Revit Structural, BIM 360 Cloud, and other structural analysis software. At least 5 years of experience in design and construction projects. Must be willing to work on-site.

JOB SUMMARY: The Building Engineer (BE) is responsible for the overall technical aspects of the property to which he is assigned. His responsibilities are classified into 4 major objectives: Construction Monitoring, Preventive Maintenance Programs, Daily Operations and Property Enhancement. A 5th major objective is Personality Development, which aims to help the individual develop into a well-rounded employee of EPPI. In the absence of the Building Manager (BM), the BE is expected to be able to take over all the responsibility of the property, including the BM’s four major functions: Operations, Finance, Property Enhancement and Community Development. JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Construction Monitoring Building Construction Participates during the testing and commissioning of the property’s machinery and equipment; ensure that all equipment and utilities undergo proper testing and commissioning prior to turn over. Coordinates with the project construction proponent regarding the property requirements for the general operations of all technical aspect of the property; ensure that the construction group submits all requirements for turn-over. Familiarize himself with all the technical aspects of the building such as equipment, facilities, interior and exterior works, etc. Tenant Fit-out Provides technical input during the preparation of the Construction and Design Guidelines for the tenant fit-out. Evaluates tenant construction plans and endorse approval by the assigned authorized personnel of the association or EPPI; ensure that all plans are evaluated and released on schedule. Make sure that if there is a required Government Permit prior to any renovation activity, it should be implemented as required. Conducts regular inspection of tenant fit-out and monitor compliance to Construction and Design Guidelines as well as on the approved plans. Preventive Maintenance Programs Machinery and Equipment Studies all equipment manuals, prepare and implement preventive maintenance programs for all equipment. Prepares monitoring and preventive maintenance forms for all equipment and machine rooms. Orients contractual personnel on the specifications of all equipment and maintenance programs. Implements and monitor compliance of contractual personnel and contractors of the maintenance programs. Ensures that all building equipment are operational at all times. Ensures that all machineries’ permit to operate are renewed on time. Ensures that all critical machineries and equipment are covered by a maintenance contract. Ensures that replaceable equipment/utilities/machineries parts are available prior to expected date of replacement. Ensures that there is sufficient stock of frequently used materials for operations. Fire Safety Prepares and implement fire safety standards and procedures for the property. Coordinates fire safety plan with security, technical maintenance, housekeeping and other contractual personnel. Prepares preventive maintenance programs for all fire protection and fire alarm equipment and devices. Inspects, tests, and monitors all fire protection equipment. Ensures that fire hazards in the building are eliminated. Energy Management Assists the BM prepare Energy Management Programs and guidelines for the property. Assists the BM formulate and implement the Energy Management Plan for coordination with the building tenant’s representatives as well as the contractual technical personnel. Monitors compliance to the Energy Management Guidelines and summarize cost savings for presentation to the Board. Solid Waste Management Assists BM prepare a Solid Waste Management Program and guidelines for the Property. Implements and monitors compliance to the Solid Waste Management Program in coordination with the tenant representatives. Daily Operations Ensures that all equipment is operational during the scheduled operating hours. Monitors and records all utilities consumption (electricity, water and diesel fuel) to see if daily consumption is within budget. Monitors and inspects all equipment to check operational conditions. Responds to tenants and customers’ needs within 24 hours regarding technical matters. Assists the BM in implementing the Security and Housekeeping Guidelines of the Property. Assists the BM in implementing the provisions of the House Rules and Master Deed of the Property. Property Enhancement Provides inputs for innovations, minor, major and capital expenditure projects. Prepares the scope of work, canvass supplier/contractors and evaluate bids for projects. Monitors all projects being implemented. Personal Development Abides by all EPPI, policies and guidelines. Projects an image becoming of a well-rounded corporate employee of EPPI, as stated in the Company’s code of ethics. Participates actively in company activities such as company meetings, training seminars and social affairs as well as activities of the Association. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must be a licensed Engineer. With at least 3 years of working experience in the related field is required. With knowledge in Property Operations Can deal with difficult tenants or situations. Good in both written and oral communications. With knowledge in basic accounting and can forecast budget and monitor expenditures. Performs other tasks assigned by his/her superiors.

Job Description: 1. To ensure the correct procedure is adopted to successfully launch a new project immediately following the award of contract. 2. To ensure the correct project implementation procedure is adopted to facilitate the accurate forecasting of the final position of projects at completion. 3. To provide a standard project report pack and guidelines that facilitates the accurate and regular reporting of the projects’ progress and status to the Management. 4. To manage, monitor and assess CM/Contractor/SC/Major Suppliers adherence to the Construction program in order to complete the project within the contract period. 5. To manage, monitor work methods and performance of CM/MC/SC and PE’s in order to ensure compliance with their obligations and the company’s management plan. 6. To coordinate with the AOR/Design Team in order to get the latest approved drawings in accordance with the project progress plan. 7. To advise and provide input into negotiation and selection of MC/SC and suppliers trade activities in order to meet project budgeted cost and quality. 8. To monitor HSE concerns at site in order to ensure a safe working environment, in line with the Management Systems Manual and Project Management Plans. 9. Coordinate interfaces between Design Team/Project Team/Client/MC/SC, Major Suppliers in order to ensure project requirements are managed. PROJECT IN CHARGE: Must be a 5 years graduate of Engineering (BS Civil Engineerl) Must be a License Board Passer With Minimum 3 to 5 years experience in Construction Computer and AutoCad Literate Willing to start as soon as possible Within Metro Manila Salary and Benefits negotiable JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change. Meets technical objectives by forecasting requirements; preparing an annual budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions. Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

As a Construction Director / Operations manager, your job is to oversee a construction project on behalf of your employer. ... You may also coach and mentor employees, help with strategic planning for company growth, and develop professional relationships with both your employer and your company's customers. The Construction Director / Operations Manager role is mainly to implement the right processes and practices across the organization . The specific duties of an Construction Director / Operations Manager include formulating strategy, improving performance, procuring material and resources and securing compliance.

Job Description The purpose of this position is to apply basic design engineering principles as listed. This role has the responsibility to promote GSL Group + Partners-Inc competitiveness within the marketplace by delivering quality services of unmatched value and technical competence. This position supports the Area Lead or Lead on assigned projects and evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques to a small set of routine assignments. Employ cost competitive engineering techniques to develop the most cost-effective total project solution for execution of the discipline engineering work Review vendor equipment documentation within the discipline and from other disciplines for compliance with project requirements, and actively seek discrepancy resolution Participate in activities associated with equipment and material procurement, permitting, and subcontracting Adhere to industry codes and standards as well as department practices and procedures Analyze and make independent recommendations regarding solutions to problems with varying complexity in accordance with organization and/or project objectives and guidelines Organize and prioritize a variety of projects and multiple tasks in an effective and timely manner, set priorities, and meet deadlines Other duties as assigned Under general supervision, perform more detailed design and exhibit thorough understanding of pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practices; Prepare working drawings and sketches, and structural calculations; Perform and check the most routine types of calculations and design using both computer-aided and manual design techniques Utilize vendor data and work with personnel from other disciplines as required for the performance of designs; Perform squad check of vendor data and drawings from other discipline; Travel, as required, to ensure the successful execution of project and/or department goals; Provide assistance to the Lead Engineer or perform duties as an Lead as requested; and Participate in department training programs/seminars and on-line training. Basic Job Requirements Accredited four (5) year degree or global equivalent in engineering field of study and five (5) years of work-related experience; a recognized professional certification or registration in the applicable field, if required; some locations may have additional or different qualifications in order to comply with local requirements Telecommunication Industry (telecom towers, etc) experience is a plus. Ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and visitors Job related technical knowledge necessary to complete the job Ability to learn and apply knowledge of applicable local, state/province, and federal/national statutes and guidelines Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner Other Job Requirements Computer literate using MS Office and AutoCAD; Knowledge in structural analysis software such as STAAD, MS Tower, ETABS or RISA is an advantage; Knowledge in industry codes and standards (e.g. ACI, AISC, API, TIA/EIA, NSCP 2015) is an advantage; A team player Preferred Qualifications Engineer-in-Training achievement status accomplished Advanced knowledge of discipline codes and standards, commercial availability and cost of materials Practical field experience Intermediate computer and software skills to include the use of word processing, e-mail, spreadsheet and electronic presentation programs
