JOB DESCRIPTION: The position holder is responsible for planning, directing and coordinating projects. Creates plans and gather design requirements for new structures. Controlling projects from start to finish to ensure hig quality, innovative and functional design developing architecture in line with client's needs, building's usage ang environmental impact. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Design project and/or review of structural plans, specifications, and contract documents to ensure compliance with the government codes, law, and regulations. Advises Subcontractors on the interpretation of p-lans, recommends changes when necessary. Prepares and/or review preliminary designs, working drawings, specifications and cost estimates relates to the project. Provides technical expertise in development or review of policies and procedures in relation to architectural structures and system codes and methods of application. Researches literature and maintain knowledge of current building materials, structural, mechanical and electrical system codes and methods of application. Review shop drawings to ensure compliance with specifications and contract agreements by checking them for technical accuracy according to accepted guidelines. Works with the customer and Clients to gather facts, defines design and space planning problems, conceptualize possible solutions and secure approvals of proposals. Reviews product literature, analyzes materials and determines appropriateness for application to projects. Provides advice and develop design documents to initiate and modify architectural design space planning solutions. Performs design drafting including preliminary drawings, working drawings and full detail drawings for architectural, structural and mechanical works associated with the building construction or improvement projects. Provides finish selections including color palettes, carpet and wall finishes, lightning and other various interior selection. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Must possess a professional license in the field civil engineering / ASEP Member. Several years required of experience. Ability to successfully lead a team of disciplines and consultants Seld-directed with clear communication and interpersonal skills Ability to organize project design development and production delivery Work with governing authorities on obtaining building permits, documenting code review and approvals Ability to work under pressure, prioritize multiple tasks and adjust work accordingly, often against fast deadlines. Able to start by January 2020

Review of bills of quantities and item lists. Checking and certification of bills and invoices from vendors, contractors. Prepare Preliminary Estimates at proposal stages. Prepares weekly and monthly reports, look-ahead schedules, impact schedule and catch-up plan, etc. Responsible for the study of BOQ as per specifications and taking out quantities from drawings. Arithmetic and technical checking of all bills i.e. civil and electrical works, steel works, material invoices, etc. Physical checking of bills at site case to case. Material Reconciliation QUALIFICATIONS: Must be a registered Civil Engineer Minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience Strong leadership, people management, and project management experience Above average communication and coordination skills

Job Summary: The Contract Specialist Administrator performs a vital role in ensuring compliance with the contract documents by the various internal departments and by the project teams, who may themselves be performing some duties typically attributed to a contract administrator. This oversight role includes subcontracts which are executed by Supply Chain Management for work packages that may be required for individuals. The Contract Specialist can cooperate with the Government agencies often work with private-sector organizations, suppliers, and contractors. For example, they may hire construction companies to build new roads or restore old buildings. Contract specialists who work for the government are in charge of drafting contracts and negotiating prices between the parties involved. These professionals may also be asked to solve disputes between contractors and government agencies, evaluate bids, cancel, or modify contracts, and maintain relationships with vendors. KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Ø Ensure that the copies of CEEC signed contracts are scanned by Project Development and uploaded to the company’s central documents management system. Ø Obtains copies of all Subcontract Agreements and Contract Orders executed by CEEC Top Management or the Supply Chain Management and scan them into the appropriate electronic project folder in the company’s central document management system (Dems). Ø Monitors every individual in actual operation performance and make sure that any subcontractor Variation Order claims are processed and responded to. Ø Provide assistance to the management in making sure that RFPs are properly prepare before issuing to subcontractor for financial and technical proposals for work packages. Ø Act as a point of contact for Project managers / Construction Managers with regards to receiving all input, notices and supporting documents necessary Request for Variations. Ø Prepare draft documents of Request for Variations for the approval of the Head of Contracts & Risk Management and the Project Manager. Ø Monitor cost vs budget reports and progress billing reports to ensure objective are being met. Ø To ensure that all concerns from Clients and Government well address properly. Ø To handle all permitting concerns to the Government process. Ø Must be Negotiation expertise between the Government Projects Ø With 5 years of experience. TECHNICAL: · Good analytical Skills. · Knowledgeable in contracts and subcontract requirements. · Proficient in using Microsoft Office operations (Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint). · Knowledgeable in Primavera P6. BEHAVIORAL: · Good interpersonal and communication skills. · Highly organized, resourceful, and dependable. · Good attention to details. · Good analytical skills. · Good skills in coordination, problem-solving and timely problem escalation.

Job Title: Project Engineer for Clark, Pampanga Office
Job Description: FedEx Express is a worldwide express transportation and global distribution company. FedEx Express provides customs-cleared, door-to-door guaranteed service to many countries worldwide with unmatched air route networks and an extensive air/ground infrastructure. Our team is renowned for progressive people culture, customer service technology and initiatives. We currently have a full-time Engineer/Sr. Engineer position in our Planning & Engineering (P&E) Department. The successful candidate will perform the end-to-end process engineering support to the operations of FedEx in Philippines. The key responsibilities of this role include, but not limited to the following: • Development and implementation of operating plans based on best practices • Follow and provide input on new and existing procedures/processes • Create an analytical process that justifies business decision • Driver of continuous process improvements • Capacity modelling which includes, but not limited to, work flow planning, space requirements, equipment layout & staffing models • Review service performance matrices and analyse service changes impact • Initiate, Lead and/or coordinate special project initiatives including cross functional projects • Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as required • Presentation of data/business proposals to Local or Regional senior management • Other tasks with the objective to ensure cost and service efficiency while enhancing customer experience To apply for this challenging role, you must meet the following criteria: • A Bachelor's Degree in Industrial/Systems Engineering or related discipline • A minimum of two year's solid working experience in a similar environment providing engineering support to Operations, or in industrial engineering, or in network planning • Excellent analytical, conceptual and planning skills • Excellent communication skills, with positive attitude and strong work ethic • Good business acumen • Creative thinking/problem solving skills with passion to drive improvement • Excellent computer skills with proficiency of MS Office Suites, Visio or relevant process design/operation research software

A customer service background is an advantage but not required Stong analytical and critical thinking skills with a high level of accuracy in calculation and design Willing to work in Cauayan City, Isabela

The position ensures that necessary manpower, materials, and equipment are available to execute repair activities. The QC Engineer also manages turnover of units to the homeowners and/or homeowners’ association (HOA) and assists in management of homeowner relations. Finally, the QC Engineer performs the tasks of a Project Point Person (PPP) when assigned. EMPLOYMENT DETAILS: Company: Asiapac Green Renewable Energy Corp (AGREC), an affiliate company Location: Mountain Province, Philippines Salary: To be discussed in person Benefits: Standard Contract: Contract Duration: 24 to 36 Months Start Date: ASAP QUALIFICATIONS: Licensed Engineer 10-15 years of international or local of engineering and construction, civil works projects, planning, design and engineering of hydropower project construction experience. Experience of hydropower construction management, preferably in dam, tunnel and hydropower projects are absolutely essential. Knowledgeable in MS Office, MS Project, Autocad Can do estimate / project scheduling(PERT/CPM/BAR CHART) Knowledge of Primavera Excellent Leadership skills / Project Management experience from similar roles Leadership/ Broad knowledge of civil engineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering including transmission, and with deep subject matter expertise in at least one of the disciplines. Construction Methods and Procedures Process Improvement Technical Understanding / Ability to read and understand drawings and specifications. Documentation Skills Safety Management Project Supervision Strong written and verbal communication skills. Time management and organizational skills. Strong mindset and ability to drive Safety Culture across the Project Positive Attitudes and Flexible working attitudes Able to travel overseas to remote locations immediately Preperably more than 30 years old. RESPONSIBILITIES: Develops project objectives by reviewing project proposals and plans; conferring with management. Determines project responsibilities by identifying project phases and elements; assigning personnel to phases and elements; reviewing bids from contractors. Determines project specifications by studying project design and requirements, and performance standards; completing technical studies; preparing cost estimates. Determines project schedule by studying project plan and specifications; calculating time requirements; sequencing project elements. Controls project plan by reviewing engineering design, specifications, and plan and schedule changes; recommending actions. Controls project costs by approving expenditures; administering contractor contracts. Supervising site construction works, including Civil Works Dam/ Weir Intake Structure, Haedrace, Surgetank, Penstock, Power House, Tailrace Channel, Substation, Series on Internal Access Road. Electromechanical Works such as Turbine, Generator, Control Panel, Governors, Power Transformers and Related Generating Sets Electrical Service (Plant wiring and :Lighting 13.2 / 69 KV tie line. Complete required tasks daily: Timecards, Purchase Orders, Work Orders, Daily Paperwork Packet and collecting Subcontractor Daily Job Reports. Inspect/verify material deliveries. Prepares project status reports by collecting project photos, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends; recommending actions. Liaison with the Client, Project Manager and top management to administer the preparation of contract documents and to assist in the management of the construction activities of the Contractor in accordance with the requirements of the Contract; Taking up technical issues with the Designer and the Head Office when necessary. Maintains project schedule by monitoring project progress; coordinating activities; resolving problems. Monitoring project progress and evaluation of progress payments; Assessing claims for variations of contract submitted by the Contractor; Maintains project data base by writing computer programs; entering and backing up data. Keeping records up to date of meetings and other relevant correspondence. Maintain job Rental Authorization Log, job files and as-builts. Maintain thorough understanding of contract documents and subcontracts. Analyzing and resolving field construction issues. Maintains company reputation by complying with construction policies, rules and regulations. Maintains safe and clean working environment by enforcing procedures, rules, and regulations. Participating in regular meetings with the civil contractor and the Client and reporting on contractual issues; Manage project closeout and obtain all warranties required for final acceptance.
